analyzed: de la bsod snyoms dag phul cig ces smras pa dang de gang na gnas zhes mi shes nas ji tsam na rgyal pos grong khyer stong phrag drug cu lo stong phrag drug cur sbyin pa dag byin yang rang sangs rgyas de la bsod snyoms gcig kyang ma phul
translated: Since they did not know where he lived, the king gave gifts for sixty thousand years in sixty thousand cities, but he did not offer even one alms to that pratyekabuddha.

analyzed: sbyin pa ni rnam pa brgyad de /

translated: Generosity out of affection, generosity out of fear, generosity out of hope for reciprocity, generosity out of desire for the fruits of generosity in future lives, generosity out of desire for fame, generosity out of desire for the ornaments of the teaching, generosity out of desire for the ornaments of concentration, and generosity out of desire for the attainment of the supreme goal.

translated: Generosity out of desire for the ornaments of the teaching, generosity out of desire for the ornaments of concentration, and generosity out of desire for the attainment of the supreme goal are called the best generosity, the most excellent generosity, the generosity of the noble ones.

original: gtso bo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the principal generosity.

original: bla ma zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bla ma zhes brjod do //

analyzed: 'di lta ste ba las 'o ma /

original: byis pa gzhon nu nad pa mal stan la nyal ba rnams kyis tshul khrims zhes bya ba yang mi shes na /
analyzed: byis pa gzhon nu nad pa mal stan la nyal ba rnams kyis tshul khrims zhes bya ba yang mi shes na /
translated: Fools, children, and the sick in bed do not even know what morality is,

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas sems kun nas dkris te gnas pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas sems kun nas dkris te gnas pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: let alone that they are bound by the fetters of grasping at morality and asceticism as supreme.

original: 'on kyang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i bag la nyal dang ni rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i bag la nyal dang ni rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
translated: But it is related to the latent form of grasping at morality and asceticism as supreme.

original: byis pa gzhon nu nad pa mal stan la nyal ba rnams kyis the tshom zhes bya ba yang mi shes na the tshom gyi phra rgyas kyis sems kun nas dkris te gnas pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyu dag smod
analyzed: byis pa gzhon nu nad pa mal stan la nyal ba rnams kyis the tshom zhes bya ba yang mi shes na the tshom gyi phra rgyas kyis sems kun nas dkris te gnas pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyu dag smod
translated: Fools, children, and the sick in bed do not even know what doubt is, let alone that they are bound by the fetters of the latent tendencies of doubt.

original: cing bshung bar byed na /
analyzed: cing bshung bar byed na /
translated: The non-Buddhist ascetics disparage and insult them,🔽saying, “They are fools, children, and the sick in bed.

original: de la khyod ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: de la khyod ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think about this?

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa mchod byed kyi ma can kha rog par 'dug cing zhum par gyur cing phrag ba bcum bar gyur cing 'og tu bltas te spobs pa med par gyur nas /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa mchod byed kyi ma can kha rog par 'dug cing zhum par gyur cing phrag ba bcum bar gyur cing 'og tu bltas te spobs pa med par gyur nas /
translated: When this was said, the mother of Venerable Upacelā sat silent, dejected, with shoulders drooping and head down, unable to respond.

original: sems bzhin du gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: sems bzhin du gnas par gyur to //
translated: She remained there with her mind withdrawn.

original: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo bcom ldan 'das kyi sku rgyab na rlung yab thogs te bcom ldan 'das la g-yob cing 'dug par gyur te de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo bcom ldan 'das kyi sku rgyab na rlung yab thogs te bcom ldan 'das la g-yob cing 'dug par gyur te de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: At that time, Venerable Ānanda was standing behind the Blessed One, fanning him. He said to the Blessed One,

original: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la tha ma'i tshe dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga bsten pa'i dus ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lags te /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la tha ma'i tshe dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga bsten pa'i dus ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lags te /
translated: “Blessed One, this is the time for the Blessed One to teach the five fetters that are suitable for the end of life.

original: bde bar gshegs pa 'di lags so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa 'di lags so //
translated: Sugata, this is the time.

original: bcom ldan 'das las thos nas dge slong rnams kyis 'dzin par 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las thos nas dge slong rnams kyis 'dzin par 'gyur lags so //
translated: Having heard it from the Blessed One, the monks will retain it.”

original: kun dga' bo de'i phyir legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig dang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo de'i phyir legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig dang bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, listen well and pay attention, and I will explain.

original: kun dga' bo 'di na kha cig 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems kyis lan mang du gnas te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di na kha cig 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems kyis lan mang du gnas te /
translated: Ānanda, here some people often dwell with a mind that is completely bound up with desire for sensual pleasures.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa skyes pa rnams la nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes te /🔽des 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas @261a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa skyes pa rnams la nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes te / des 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas @261a * //
translated: They do not know as it really is the escape from the arising of the completely bound up desire for sensual pleasures.

original: dkris pa tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba de dag la yang dag pa'i stobs kyis spong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: dkris pa tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba de dag la yang dag pa'i stobs kyis spong bar mi byed do //
translated: By the power of that, they do not abandon the completely bound up desire for sensual pleasures that are the fetters associated with the lower part.

original: kun dga' bo 'di na kha cig gnod sems dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems kyis lan mang du gnas te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di na kha cig gnod sems dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems kyis lan mang du gnas te /
translated: Ānanda, here some people often dwell with a mind that is completely bound up with malice, the view of the transitory collection, holding a discipline and ritual to be paramount, and doubt.

original: the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa skyes pa rnams la phyis nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes te /
analyzed: the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa skyes pa rnams la phyis nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes te /
translated: Those who have given rise to the fetters of doubt do not know the true nature of the path to liberation.

original: des the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba de dag yang dag pa'i stobs kyis spong bar byed do //🔽kun dga' bo lam gang zhig rtogs pas tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spong bar 'gyur ba'i lam de des ma rtogs par tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas ma
analyzed: des the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba de dag yang dag pa'i stobs kyis spong bar byed do // kun dga' bo lam gang zhig rtogs pas tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spong bar 'gyur ba'i lam de des ma rtogs par tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas ma
translated: They abandon the fetters of doubt that are associated with the lower realms through the power of the true path.

original: yin zhing go skabs med do //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: yin zhing go skabs med do // 'di lta ste /
translated: “Ānanda, it is impossible and there is no chance that one could abandon the five fetters associated with the lower realms without realizing the path that leads to the abandonment of the five fetters associated with the lower realms.

original: kun dga' bo mig dang ldan pa'i skyes bu snying po tshol zhing don du gnyer ba dag sta re rnon po thogs nas na gas su zhugs te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo mig dang ldan pa'i skyes bu snying po tshol zhing don du gnyer ba dag sta re rnon po thogs nas na gas su zhugs te /
translated: “Ānanda, it is just as when a person who has eyes and who is searching for and seeking the essence of wood takes an axe and enters a forest.

original: des de na shing chen po rtsa ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: des de na shing chen po rtsa ba dang ldan pa /
translated: He sees a large tree with a trunk and roots.

original: lo ma dang ldan pa /
analyzed: lo ma dang ldan pa /
translated: it has leaves,

original: yal ga dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yal ga dang ldan pa /
translated: it has branches,🔽it has flowers and fruit.

original: 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu dang ldan pa zhig mthong nas 'di skad du ngas shing 'di'i rtsa ba ma bcad cing rtse mo ma bcad par yal ga dang 'dab ma dang / me tog dang snying po dag khyer nas 'gro bar bya'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu dang ldan pa zhig mthong nas 'di skad du ngas shing 'di'i rtsa ba ma bcad cing rtse mo ma bcad par yal ga dang 'dab ma dang / me tog dang snying po dag khyer nas 'gro bar bya'o zhes zer na /
translated: If someone were to say, ‘I will take away the trunk, the top, the branches, the leaves, the flowers, and the fruit of this tree without cutting it down at the root,’

original: de skad du ma smra cig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de skad du ma smra cig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: you should say to them, ‘Don’t say such a thing!

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do //
translated: It is impossible and there is no chance that

original: gang yang skyes bu 'dis shing gi rtsa ba ma bcad par yal ga dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang snying po khyer nas 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do //
analyzed: gang yang skyes bu 'dis shing gi rtsa ba ma bcad par yal ga dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang snying po khyer nas 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do //
translated: this person will take away the trunk, the top, the branches, the leaves, the flowers, and the fruit of this tree without cutting it down at the root.

original: kun dga' bo de bzhin du lam gang zhig rtogs pas tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spong bar 'gyur ba'i lam de des ma rtogs par tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spong bar 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas ma🔽yin zhing go skabs med do //🔽kun dga' bo lam gang zhig rtogs pas tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i @261b kun du sbyor ba lnga spong bar 'gyur ba'i lam de des rtogs na /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bzhin du lam gang zhig rtogs pas tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spong bar 'gyur ba'i lam de des ma rtogs par tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spong bar 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do // kun dga' bo lam gang zhig rtogs pas tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i @261b kun du sbyor ba lnga spong bar 'gyur ba'i lam de des rtogs na /
translated: Ānanda, in the same way, it is impossible and there is no chance that one will abandon the five fetters that are associated with the lower realms without realizing the path by which they are abandoned.

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spong bar 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas yin zhing go skabs yod do //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spong bar 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas yin zhing go skabs yod do //
translated: Ānanda, it is possible and there is a chance that one will abandon the five fetters that are associated with the lower realms by realizing the path by which they are abandoned.

original: kun dga' bo 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di lta ste /
translated: Ānanda, it is like this:

original: mig dang ldan pa'i skyes bu snying po tshol zhing don du gnyer ba dag sta re rnon po thogs nas nags su zhugs te des de na shing chen po rtsa ba dang ldan pa dang / sdong po dang ldan pa yal ga dang 'dab ma dang 'bras bu dang ldan pa zhig mthong nas de 'di skad du ngas shing 'di'i rtsa ba bcad de rtse mo bcad nas yal ga dang lo ma dang me tog dang snying po dag /
analyzed: mig dang ldan pa'i skyes bu snying po tshol zhing don du gnyer ba dag sta re rnon po thogs nas nags su zhugs te des de na shing chen po rtsa ba dang ldan pa dang / sdong po dang ldan pa yal ga dang 'dab ma dang 'bras bu dang ldan pa zhig mthong nas de 'di skad du ngas shing 'di'i rtsa ba bcad de rtse mo bcad nas yal ga dang lo ma dang me tog dang snying po dag /
translated: A person who has eyes, who seeks and desires the essence, would take a sharp axe and enter the forest. Having seen a great tree there, with roots, trunk, branches, leaves, flowers and fruits, he would say:

original: khyer nas 'gro bar bya'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: khyer nas 'gro bar bya'o zhes zer na /
translated: “I will cut the roots of this tree, cut the top, and take away the branches, leaves, flowers and heartwood.🔽”

original: de bzhin ni zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin ni zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: He should say: “It is just so.🔽”

original: de ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni gnas yin zhing skabs yod do //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas yin zhing skabs yod do //
translated: “This is possible and there is an occasion for it.🔽”

original: gang yang skyes bu des shing gi rtsa ba bcad cing rtse mo dag bcad nas yal ga dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang snying po dag khyer nas 'gro ba 'di ni gnas yin zhing go skabs yod do //
analyzed: gang yang skyes bu des shing gi rtsa ba bcad cing rtse mo dag bcad nas yal ga dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang snying po dag khyer nas 'gro ba 'di ni gnas yin zhing go skabs yod do //
translated: And if that person cuts the roots of the tree, cuts the top, and takes away the branches, leaves, flowers and heartwood, this is possible and there is an occasion for it.

original: kun dga' bo de bzhin du 'dis lam thob par rtogs pas tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams spang bar 'gyur ba'i lam de des rtogs nas tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams spong bar 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas yin
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bzhin du 'dis lam thob par rtogs pas tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams spang bar 'gyur ba'i lam de des rtogs nas tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams spong bar 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas yin
translated: Ānanda, in the same way, since this person has realized the path, he will abandon the fetters that are associated with the lower realms. Having realized the path that will abandon the fetters that are associated with the lower realms, he will abandon the fetters that are associated with the lower realms. This is possible.

original: zhing go skabs yod do //
analyzed: zhing go skabs yod do //
translated: This is feasible.

original: kun dga' bo lam ni gang rtogs pas tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams spong ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun dga' bo lam ni gang rtogs pas tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams spong ba gang zhe na /
translated: Ānanda, what is the path that, when realized, will abandon the fetters that are associated with the lower realms?

original: kun dga' bo 'di na kha cig 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems kyis lan mang du mi gnas te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di na kha cig 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems kyis lan mang du mi gnas te /
translated: Ānanda, in this case, some people do not frequently remain with a mind that is completely bound up with desire for sensual pleasures.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun du dkris pa skyes pa rnams las phyis nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun du dkris pa skyes pa rnams las phyis nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: They correctly understand the arising of the fetters that are completely bound up with desire for sensual pleasures as they truly are.

original: des 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas de dag stobs kyis so sor legs par btul te phra rgyas dang bcas pa spong bar byed do //
analyzed: des 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas de dag stobs kyis so sor legs par btul te phra rgyas dang bcas pa spong bar byed do //
translated: They fully and properly subdue those negative tendencies of desire realm attachment through their strength and abandon them along with their negative tendencies.

original: kun dga' bo 'di na kha cig gnod sems dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems kyis lan mang du mi gnas te /🔽the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa skyes pa rnams las phyis nges par 'byung ba @262a * //
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di na kha cig gnod sems dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems kyis lan mang du mi gnas te / the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa skyes pa rnams las phyis nges par 'byung ba @262a * //
translated: Ananda, some do not frequently abide with a mind that is afflicted by malice, the afflicted view of the perishing aggregates, holding ethics and spiritual disciplines as paramount, or doubt.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes te /
translated: They know the origin of doubt and its cessation just as it is.🔽They fully and properly subdue that afflicted doubt through its strength and abandon it along with its negative tendencies.

original: des the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa de stobs kyis so sor btul te phra rgyas dang bcas pa spong bar byed do zhes bya ba'i mdo'i dum bu lung bar ma las /🔽gso sbyong can dang ta la can //
analyzed: des the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa de stobs kyis so sor btul te phra rgyas dang bcas pa spong bar byed do zhes bya ba'i mdo'i dum bu lung bar ma las / gso sbyong can dang ta la can //
translated: This is a medium length citation from a sutra.🔽Those who have confession and those who have palm trees

original: dga' dang tha ma'i cha mthun bcas //
analyzed: dga' dang tha ma'i cha mthun bcas //
translated: are endowed with joy and the factors conducive to the final

original: zhes bya ba'i tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i mdo las byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i mdo las byung ngo //
translated: This is stated in the sutra called the sutra concordant with the latter end.

original: gang yang mdo las ni nyon mongs pa nyid phra rgyas su bshad de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang mdo las ni nyon mongs pa nyid phra rgyas su bshad de zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sutra explains that afflictions are negative tendencies.

original: drug tshan drug pa'i skye mched drug bstan pa'i sgo gnyis pa las /
analyzed: drug tshan drug pa'i skye mched drug bstan pa'i sgo gnyis pa las /
translated: The second chapter of the six sextets explains the six bases of contact:

original: dga' dang kun dga' las gdams pa //
analyzed: dga' dang kun dga' las gdams pa //
translated: Advice on joy and delight.

original: zhes bya ba'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bstan pa mdzod kyi gnas gsum par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skabs su /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bstan pa mdzod kyi gnas gsum par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skabs su /
translated: The third chapter of the Abhidharmakośa, the section on dependent origination, states:

original: reg drug 'dus te byung ba yin /
analyzed: reg drug 'dus te byung ba yin /
translated: The six contacts arise from the union of three.

original: zhes bya bar bris pa bzhin blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bar bris pa bzhin blta bar bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as it is written.

original: de las 'di ltar 'don te /
analyzed: de las 'di ltar 'don te /
translated: The text reads:

original: dge slong dag mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur zhing gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa dang reg pa la brten nas tshor ba bde ba'am /
analyzed: dge slong dag mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur zhing gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa dang reg pa la brten nas tshor ba bde ba'am /
translated: Bhikṣhus, eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form. The contact of the union of the three is contact. In dependence on contact, feeling arises.

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: It may be pleasant,

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and neither-painful-nor-pleasant feelings arise.

original: dge slong dag de la bde ba'i tshor ba la reg na mngon par dga' zhing mngon par brjod pa dang zhen pa dang lhag par zhen cing gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dag de la bde ba'i tshor ba la reg na mngon par dga' zhing mngon par brjod pa dang zhen pa dang lhag par zhen cing gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: “Monks, when a pleasant feeling is felt, one delights in it, expresses it verbally, and remains attached to it.

original: 'di'i bde ba'i tshor ba la 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ro //🔽dge slong dag de la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la reg na mngon par mi dga' zhing khrol gnod sems dang yongs su gdug cing mi dga' zhing gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di'i bde ba'i tshor ba la 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ro // dge slong dag de la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la reg na mngon par mi dga' zhing khrol gnod sems dang yongs su gdug cing mi dga' zhing gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, attachment to pleasant feeling increases.🔽“Monks, when a painful feeling is felt, one does not delight in it, but becomes angry, hostile, and unhappy.🔽In this way, hostility to painful feeling increases.

original: 'di'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la gnod sems rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes gang gis tshor ba gang gi kun 'byung ba dang mi snang ba dang ro myang ba dang nyes dmigs dang nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes te ;
analyzed: 'di'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la gnod sems rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes gang gis tshor ba gang gi kun 'byung ba dang mi snang ba dang ro myang ba dang nyes dmigs dang nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes te ;
translated: “Monks, when a neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is felt, one does not know as it really is the origination, the disappearance, the satisfaction, the unsatisfactoriness, and the separation with regard to this feeling.

original: 'di'i bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la ma rig pa rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la ma rig pa rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: And ignorance increases in the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain.🔽In the sutra, attachment is explained as being of two types.

original: mdo las 'dod chags rnam pa gnyis su phye nas bshad de zhes bya ba la bdun tshan bdun pa las /
analyzed: mdo las 'dod chags rnam pa gnyis su phye nas bshad de zhes bya ba la bdun tshan bdun pa las /
translated: In the seven sets of seven, it is said:

original: zag bdun yid bdun rnam shes gnas /
analyzed: zag bdun yid bdun rnam shes gnas /
translated: The seven contaminants, the seven minds, the seven consciousness abodes,

original: srid dang phra rgyas @262b bdun gcig byas //
analyzed: srid dang phra rgyas @262b bdun gcig byas //
translated: existence, and the seven negative tendencies.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phra rgyas kyi mdo las /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phra rgyas kyi mdo las /
translated: In the sutra on the negative tendencies,

original: ji ltar mngon pa mdzod kyi gnas gsum pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skabs su kun sbyor sogs chig phyir zhes bya bar bris par lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon pa mdzod kyi gnas gsum pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skabs su kun sbyor sogs chig phyir zhes bya bar bris par lta bar bya'o //
translated: it is written in the Abhidharmakośa, in the third chapter on dependent origination, as “because of the fetters and so on.”🔽Thus the Mahāvibhāṣā says:

original: 'di ltar las rnam par 'byed pa chen po'i mdo las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la 'og ma 'dod pa la dmigs pa'i lta ba kun du 'byung bar gsungs zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: 'di ltar las rnam par 'byed pa chen po'i mdo las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la 'og ma 'dod pa la dmigs pa'i lta ba kun du 'byung bar gsungs zhes bya ba la //
translated: The view that focuses on lower desire realm objects arises in those who are free from attachment.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab kyi smyug ma'i chal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs te /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab kyi smyug ma'i chal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs te /
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time the Blessed One was dwelling in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana near Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa dran pa rgyal po'i khab kyi dgon pa'i dbyar khang na 'dug par gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa dran pa rgyal po'i khab kyi dgon pa'i dbyar khang na 'dug par gyur te /
translated: At that time, the venerable Sāgata was staying in the rainy season residence in the forest near Rājagṛha.

original: kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu tshe dang ldan pa dran pa gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu tshe dang ldan pa dran pa gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: The wandering mendicant Potaliya went to where the venerable Sāgata was.

original: nye bar song nas tshe dang ldan pa dran pa dang lhan cig yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur pa dang / yang dag par bde bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: nye bar song nas tshe dang ldan pa dran pa dang lhan cig yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur pa dang / yang dag par bde bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Having approached him, he sat down to one side and had a variety of worldly conversations with the venerable Sāgata, which were pleasant, pleasing, and agreeable.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas kun tu rgyu po ta la'i bus tshe dang ldan pa dran pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas kun tu rgyu po ta la'i bus tshe dang ldan pa dran pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: After sitting down to one side, the wandering mendicant Potaliya said to the venerable Sāgata:

original: dran pa dris pa lung ston pa la skabs 'byed na bdag phyogs 'ga' zhig 'dri'o //
analyzed: dran pa dris pa lung ston pa la skabs 'byed na bdag phyogs 'ga' zhig 'dri'o //
translated: “Sāgata, if you would grant me the opportunity, I would like to ask you about a certain matter.”

original: po ta la'i bu dris shig dang / thos nas rig par bya'o //🔽dran pa gang las lus kyi las kyi 'bras bu med cing dag gi las kyi 'bras bu med pa /
analyzed: po ta la'i bu dris shig dang / thos nas rig par bya'o // dran pa gang las lus kyi las kyi 'bras bu med cing dag gi las kyi 'bras bu med pa /
translated: and when you hear it, you will know.”

original: yid kyi las kyi 'bras bu med pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i dge slong cung zad cig yod do zhes nga smra'o zhes bdag gis dge sbyong goo ta ma las mngon sum du thos nas mngon sum du bzung
analyzed: yid kyi las kyi 'bras bu med pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i dge slong cung zad cig yod do zhes nga smra'o zhes bdag gis dge sbyong goo ta ma las mngon sum du thos nas mngon sum du bzung
translated: “I have heard directly from the ascetic Gautama and have directly received this recollection: ‘There are some monks who have entered into such samādhi and the absorption of samādhi that the results of physical actions do not exist, the results of verbal actions do not exist, and the results of mental actions do not exist.’

original: ste / dran pa 'di la khyod ji skad du smra /
analyzed: ste / dran pa 'di la khyod ji skad du smra /
translated: What do you say about this recollection?”

original: po ta la'i bu gang yang lus kyi las kya 'bras bu med cing ngag gi las kyi 'bras bu med la yid kyi las kyi 'bras bu med pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i dge slong cung zad cig yod
analyzed: po ta la'i bu gang yang lus kyi las kya 'bras bu med cing ngag gi las kyi 'bras bu med la yid kyi las kyi 'bras bu med pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i dge slong cung zad cig yod
translated: “Poṭaḷa, there are some monks who have entered into such samādhi and the absorption of samādhi that the results of physical actions do not exist, the results of verbal actions do not exist, and the results of mental actions do not exist.

original: do zhes smra'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'i don bdag gis mi shes mod kyi /
analyzed: do zhes smra'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'i don bdag gis mi shes mod kyi /
translated: I do not understand the meaning of what the Blessed One said.

original: 'on kyang gang gi las byas shing bsags pa nye bar bsags pa dag gi rnam par smin pa so sor mi myong ba ma yin no zhes @263a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi las byas shing bsags pa nye bar bsags pa dag gi rnam par smin pa so sor mi myong ba ma yin no zhes @263a * //
translated: But I do say that the ripening of karma that is done and accumulated is not experienced individually.

original: nga smra ste /
analyzed: nga smra ste /
translated: I say this.

original: de yang mthong ba'i chos dang skyes nas dang lan grangs gzhan la'o //
analyzed: de yang mthong ba'i chos dang skyes nas dang lan grangs gzhan la'o //
translated: And that is in this very life, in the next life, and in other lives.

original: las ma byas shing ma bsags la nye bar ma bsags pa ngag gi rnam par smin pa ni so sor myong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'i don bdag gis 'di ltar shes so //
analyzed: las ma byas shing ma bsags la nye bar ma bsags pa ngag gi rnam par smin pa ni so sor myong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'i don bdag gis 'di ltar shes so //
translated: The Blessed One explained that the ripening of karma that is not done, not accumulated, and not stored up is not experienced individually. I understand the meaning of that as follows.

original: dran pa khyod dge sbyong goo ta ma las dge sbyong du khas blangs nas ji tsam lon /
analyzed: dran pa khyod dge sbyong goo ta ma las dge sbyong du khas blangs nas ji tsam lon /
translated: “Recollection, how long has it been since you went forth from the ascetic Gautama, claiming to be an ascetic?

original: po ta la'i bu bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung nas lo gsum lhag tsam lon no //
analyzed: po ta la'i bu bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung nas lo gsum lhag tsam lon no //
translated: “I have been a renunciant in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya for more than three years.”

original: dran pa da ltar 'di na gnas brtan rgyal pos gnang ba rab tu byung nas ring du lon pa /
analyzed: dran pa da ltar 'di na gnas brtan rgyal pos gnang ba rab tu byung nas ring du lon pa /
translated: having gone forth on the basis of the teaching of the King of Kāśi.

original: dang po nyid nas tshangs par spyod pa spyad pa bstan bcos smra zhing rnam par 'byed shes pa /
analyzed: dang po nyid nas tshangs par spyod pa spyad pa bstan bcos smra zhing rnam par 'byed shes pa /
translated: I have practiced pure conduct from the beginning, I am a teacher of the treatises, and I know how to analyze.

original: tshangs par spyod pa dge slong rnams kyis ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa dge slong rnams kyis ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
translated: What will the monks who practice pure conduct do?”

original: da ltar 'di na khyod gsar bu yang dge sbyong goo ta ma la legs pa shin tu rjes su srung bar sems sam /🔽dran pa las byas shing bsags la nye bar bsags pa dag gis ni zhig myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: da ltar 'di na khyod gsar bu yang dge sbyong goo ta ma la legs pa shin tu rjes su srung bar sems sam / dran pa las byas shing bsags la nye bar bsags pa dag gis ni zhig myong bar 'gyur /
translated: “Now, young man, do you think that I am a very good protector of those who have gone for refuge?”🔽“Those who have done and accumulated actions that are to be experienced as hell are reborn in hell.🔽Those who have done and accumulated actions that are to be experienced as a god are reborn as a god.

original: po ta la'i bu las bsams bzhin byas shing bsags la nye bar bsags pas sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: po ta la'i bu las bsams bzhin byas shing bsags la nye bar bsags pas sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have done and accumulated actions that are to be experienced as a human are reborn as a human.”

original: de nas kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu tshe dang ldan pa dran pas bshad pa la dga' bar yang mi byed khro bar yang mi byed par stan las langs te song ngo //
analyzed: de nas kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu tshe dang ldan pa dran pas bshad pa la dga' bar yang mi byed khro bar yang mi byed par stan las langs te song ngo //
translated: Then the wandering mendicant Potaliya, not pleased or delighted with what the venerable Sañjīva had said, got up from his seat and left.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen po tshe dang ldan pa dran pa dang mi ring ba zhig na shing ljon pa gzhan zhig gi drung na nyin par gnas pa'i phyir 'dug go //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen pos tshe dang ldan pa dran pa dang / kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu lhan cig gtam gzhan rgyas par brjod pa rnams thos so //
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen po tshe dang ldan pa dran pa dang mi ring ba zhig na shing ljon pa gzhan zhig gi drung na nyin par gnas pa'i phyir 'dug go // de nas tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen pos tshe dang ldan pa dran pa dang / kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu lhan cig gtam gzhan rgyas par brjod pa rnams thos so //
translated: At that time, the venerable Mahākoṭṭhita was sitting at the foot of another tree nearby, in the vicinity of the venerable Sāriputta, for the sake of the daytime abiding.🔽Then the venerable Mahākoṭṭhita heard the venerable Sāriputta and the wandering Potaliya having a detailed discussion on other topics.

original: tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen po tshe dang ldan pa dran ba kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu dang lhan cig gtam gzhan brjod pa 'di ltar gyur pa thams cad bzung ste yid la byas nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen po tshe dang ldan pa dran ba kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu dang lhan cig gtam gzhan brjod pa 'di ltar gyur pa thams cad bzung ste yid la byas nas /
translated: The venerable Mahākoṭṭhita, having heard the entire discussion between the venerable Sāriputta and the wandering Potaliya on other topics, took it to heart and considered it.🔽He then approached the venerable Ānanda

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: and said to him:

original: nye bar song nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang thabs cig yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par bde bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: nye bar song nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang thabs cig yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par bde bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Having approached, he sat together with the Venerable Ānanda and had various pleasant and joyful conversations.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen pos tshe dang ldan pa dran pa kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu dang lhan cig gtam gzhan brjod pa ji ltar @263b gyur pa de thams cad rgyas par tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen pos tshe dang ldan pa dran pa kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu dang lhan cig gtam gzhan brjod pa ji ltar @263b gyur pa de thams cad rgyas par tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la
translated: Having sat to one side, the Venerable Mahā-Kausthila related in detail to the Venerable Ānanda all the other conversations that had taken place between the Venerable Aniruddha and the son of Poṭa the wanderer.

original: bsnyad do // de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: bsnyad do // de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When that was said, the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Venerable Mahā-Kausthila:

original: tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen po gtam 'di dag dang bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'gro bar gyis shig / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das la chos zab mo zab par snang ba 'di lta bu'i don dran
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen po gtam 'di dag dang bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'gro bar gyis shig / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das la chos zab mo zab par snang ba 'di lta bu'i don dran
translated: “Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita, go to the Blessed One and ask him about the meaning of this.

original: pa rnyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: pa rnyed par 'gyur /
translated: You will find the meaning of this profound teaching, which appears to be profound.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen po dang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song zhing nye bar song nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen po dang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song zhing nye bar song nas /
translated: Then Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita and Venerable Ānanda went to the Blessed One. When they arrived,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: they touched their heads to the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When they had sat to one side, Venerable Ānanda said to Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita,

original: dge slong kun dga' bo dang skul byed kyi brjod par 'dod pa dag ni bcom ldan 'das las thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong kun dga' bo dang skul byed kyi brjod par 'dod pa dag ni bcom ldan 'das las thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Venerable Ānanda and Mahākoṭṭhita will hear what they wish to hear from the Blessed One.”

original: da ltar bde bar gshegs pa las thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar bde bar gshegs pa las thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: I have heard it from the Sugata himself.🔽Then the venerable Mahākoṭṭhita related to the Blessed One in detail all the other conversations he had had with the venerable Anuruddha.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen pos tshe dang ldan pa dran pa kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu dang gtam gzhan brjod pa de thams cad bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen pos tshe dang ldan pa dran pa kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu dang gtam gzhan brjod pa de thams cad bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: kun dga' bo dge slong dran pa las rnam par 'byed pa lung ston pa la ltos /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dge slong dran pa las rnam par 'byed pa lung ston pa la ltos /
translated: “Ānanda, look at the monk Anuruddha’s exposition of the discernment of mind.

original: 'dis ni dris pa phyogs gcig tu lung bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dris pa phyogs gcig tu lung bstan to //
translated: He has given a partial exposition of the question.🔽”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda said to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa tshe dang ldan pa dran pas gang cung zad tshor ba de thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba 'di la bsams nas kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu la bshad pa'i gnas yod cing skabs yod de //
analyzed: btsun pa tshe dang ldan pa dran pas gang cung zad tshor ba de thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba 'di la bsams nas kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu la bshad pa'i gnas yod cing skabs yod de //
translated: “Venerable sir, the venerable Anuruddha has said, ‘Whatever is felt is suffering.’

original: skul byed dge slong kun dga' bo'i bsam pa la ltos /
analyzed: skul byed dge slong kun dga' bo'i bsam pa la ltos /
translated: “Ānanda, consider the thought of the monk Rāhula.

original: kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu ngas mthong ba yang dag par rjes su mi dran na de dang lhan cig bar skabs kyi gtam brjod pa 'di lta bu lta smos kyang ci dgos //
analyzed: kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu ngas mthong ba yang dag par rjes su mi dran na de dang lhan cig bar skabs kyi gtam brjod pa 'di lta bu lta smos kyang ci dgos //
translated: I do not even remember seeing the wandering mendicant Potaliya, let alone having a conversation with him.”

original: btsun pa ji ltar na tshe dang ldan pa dran pas kun du rgyu po ta la'i bus dri ba dris pa'i lung bstan pa /🔽yang dag par @264a * //
analyzed: btsun pa ji ltar na tshe dang ldan pa dran pas kun du rgyu po ta la'i bus dri ba dris pa'i lung bstan pa / yang dag par @264a * //
translated: “Lord, how will the venerable Rāhula answer the questions of the wandering mendicant Potaliya,🔽so that he will be able to give a complete and

original: lung bstan par byas par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: lung bstan par byas par 'gyur lags /
translated: perfect answer?”

original: kun dga' bo dge slong dran pas kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu'i dri ba dris pa la 'di ltar lung bstan na yang dag par lung bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dge slong dran pas kun du rgyu po ta la'i bu'i dri ba dris pa la 'di ltar lung bstan na yang dag par lung bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: “Ānanda, if the monk Rāhula answers the questions of the wandering mendicant Potaliya like this, he will be able to give a complete and perfect answer:

original: po ta la'i bu bsams bzhin du las byas shing nye bar bsags na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: po ta la'i bu bsams bzhin du las byas shing nye bar bsags na bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: ‘Potaliya, if you intentionally do and accumulate actions, you will experience happiness.

original: bsams bzhin du sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byas shing nye bar gas gsan sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byas shing nye bar gas gsan sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He who has done and accumulated actions that are to be experienced as painful, experiences suffering.

original: bsams bzhin du sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i las byas shing nye bar bsags na bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i las byas shing nye bar bsags na bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He who has done and accumulated actions that are to be experienced as neither-painful-nor-pleasant, experiences what is neither-painful-nor-pleasant.

original: kun dga' bo kun du rgyu po ta la'i bus ni dge slong dran pa la tshor ba gsum las bsams te dris pa dge slong dran pas gang cung zad tshor ba de thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes ni phyogs gcig lung bstan to //
analyzed: kun dga' bo kun du rgyu po ta la'i bus ni dge slong dran pa la tshor ba gsum las bsams te dris pa dge slong dran pas gang cung zad tshor ba de thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes ni phyogs gcig lung bstan to //
translated: Ānanda, the wandering mendicant Potaliya asked the monk Sāriputta about the three feelings, and Sāriputta answered him from one perspective when he said, ‘Whatever is felt is suffering.’

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dran pa'i sems la khyab ste mkhyen pa ni ngo mtshar lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dran pa'i sems la khyab ste mkhyen pa ni ngo mtshar lags so //
translated: “Lord, it is amazing that the Blessed One has penetrated the Venerable Sāriputta’s mind.”

original: kun dga' bo de bzhin gshegs pa de mkhyen pa la ngo mtshar ci zhig yod //
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bzhin gshegs pa de mkhyen pa la ngo mtshar ci zhig yod //
translated: “Ānanda, what is amazing about the Tathāgata’s penetration of his mind?

original: kun dga' bo de bzhin gshegs pa las las rnam par 'byed pa chen po zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs nyon cig dang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bzhin gshegs pa las las rnam par 'byed pa chen po zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs nyon cig dang bshad par bya'o //
translated: Ānanda, listen to the Dharma discourse called the Great Differentiation of Karma, which I will teach.🔽You should have deep faith in me.

original: nga la sems mngon par dad par gyis shig / sems mngon par dang zhing rab tu dang nas bya ba mang du byed par 'gyur ba'i gnas yin zhing skabs yod do //
analyzed: nga la sems mngon par dad par gyis shig / sems mngon par dang zhing rab tu dang nas bya ba mang du byed par 'gyur ba'i gnas yin zhing skabs yod do //
translated: With a mind of deep faith and clarity, it is possible to do many things.

original: bcom ldan 'das dus la bab cing bde bar gshegs pa dus la bab ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dus la bab cing bde bar gshegs pa dus la bab ste /
translated: Blessed One, the time has come. Sugata, the time has come.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la las rnam par 'byed pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs bshad na bcom ldan 'das las thos nas dge slong rnams kyis legs par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la las rnam par 'byed pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs bshad na bcom ldan 'das las thos nas dge slong rnams kyis legs par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //

They cause the connection from this world to the next world and from the next world to this world.

analyzed: pha rol nas 'dir nying mtshams sbyor zhing 'khor la 'khor bar 'jug par byed pa dag go / bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: They cause the connection to the cycle of existence and the entry into the cycle of existence. What are the four?

original: mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes sems can rnams 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log ste /🔽phyin ci log 'dis sems can rnams kyi sems phyin ci log tu byed pa dru bu 'dzings pa lta bu /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes sems can rnams 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log ste / phyin ci log 'dis sems can rnams kyi sems phyin ci log tu byed pa dru bu 'dzings pa lta bu /
translated: Sentient beings have a distorted perception, a distorted thought, and a distorted view with regard to the impermanent, which they believe to be permanent.

original: thags 'dzings pa lta bu /
analyzed: thags 'dzings pa lta bu /
translated: This distortion causes the mind to become distorted, like a tangled skein, like a knotted ball of thread, like muñja grass or reeds tangled in a bush.

original: rtsva munydza dang bal ba dza lta bu skye zhing 'jig pa 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du nying mtshams sbyor ba pha rol nas 'dir nying mtshams sbyor zhing 'khor la 'khor bar 'jug par byed pa dag go //
analyzed: rtsva munydza dang bal ba dza lta bu skye zhing 'jig pa 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du nying mtshams sbyor ba pha rol nas 'dir nying mtshams sbyor zhing 'khor la 'khor bar 'jug par byed pa dag go //
translated: It causes the mind to become distorted, to be reborn, to pass from this world to the next, to be reborn here from the next world, to transmigrate, to enter into the cycle of existence.

original: sdug bsngal ba la bde ba'o zhes bya ba dang mi gcang ba la gtsang ngo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag go zhes bya ba sems can rnams kyi sems phyin ci log dag gis phyin ci log tu byed pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la bde ba'o zhes bya ba dang mi gcang ba la gtsang ngo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag go zhes bya ba sems can rnams kyi sems phyin ci log dag gis phyin ci log tu byed pa ste /
translated: Sentient beings have a distorted perception, a distorted thought, and a distorted view with regard to what is painful, which they believe to be pleasant; with regard to what is impure, which they believe to be pure; and with regard to what is not a self, which they believe to be a self.🔽This distortion causes the mind to become distorted.

original: sems can rnams kyi sems phyin ci log dang lta ba phyin ci log tu byed pa dru bu 'dzings pa lta bu rtsva munydza dang bal ba dza lta bu @270a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems phyin ci log dang lta ba phyin ci log tu byed pa dru bu 'dzings pa lta bu rtsva munydza dang bal ba dza lta bu @270a * //
translated: They cause the minds and views of sentient beings to be mistaken.

original: skye zhing 'jig pa 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa pha rol nas 'dir nying mtshams sbyor zhing 'khor la 'khor bar 'jug par byed pa dag go //
analyzed: skye zhing 'jig pa 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa pha rol nas 'dir nying mtshams sbyor zhing 'khor la 'khor bar 'jug par byed pa dag go //
translated: They cause the connection to be made from this world to the next world, and from the next world to this world.🔽When the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones appear in the world, they teach the Dharma, saying:

original: gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du byung ba de'i tshe 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes chos ston par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du byung ba de'i tshe 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes chos ston par 'gyur zhing /
translated: This is the noble truth of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba //🔽'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba // 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa /
translated: This is the origin of suffering.🔽This is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mo zhes chos ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mo zhes chos ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is the path leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: dge slong dag gang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes chos ston pa thos shing /🔽'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba //
analyzed: dge slong dag gang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes chos ston pa thos shing / 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba //
translated: “Monks, when they hear the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha teaching the Dharma, saying, ‘This is the noble truth of suffering,’🔽‘This is the origin of suffering,’

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa /
translated: ‘This is the cessation of suffering,’

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mo zhes chos ston pa mthong ba de dag mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log spong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mo zhes chos ston pa mthong ba de dag mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log spong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: ‘This is the path that leads to the cessation of suffering,’ they will abandon the mistaken perception, mind, and view that what is impermanent is permanent.

original: sdug bsngal ba la bde ba'o zhes bya ba dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag go zhes bya ba 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log dang spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la bde ba'o zhes bya ba dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag go zhes bya ba 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log dang spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will abandon the mistaken perception, mind, and view that what is suffering is happiness, that what is impure is pure, and that what is not a self is a self.

original: sems can mi rtag rtag 'du shes //
analyzed: sems can mi rtag rtag 'du shes //
translated: Sentient beings perceive the impermanent as permanent,

original: sdug bsngal ba la bder 'du shes //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la bder 'du shes //
translated: They perceive what is suffering as happiness,

original: bdag med pa la bdag dang ni //
analyzed: bdag med pa la bdag dang ni //
translated: What is not a self as a self,

original: mi gtsang ba gtsang ba'i 'du shes can //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba gtsang ba'i 'du shes can //
translated: And what is impure as pure.

original: phyin ci log gyur sems can rnams //
analyzed: phyin ci log gyur sems can rnams //
translated: Sentient beings are mistaken,

original: sems g-yengs 'du shes bral bar gyur //
analyzed: sems g-yengs 'du shes bral bar gyur //
translated: Their minds distracted and lacking perception.

original: de dang ldan pa'i skye bo rnams //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i skye bo rnams //
translated: Those who possess this

original: yid mi bde ba nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: Do not become mentally unhappy.

original: be'u dag ma yi phyir 'brang ba //
analyzed: be'u dag ma yi phyir 'brang ba //
translated: Like calves following their mother,

original: skye dang rga ba'i rjes su 'jug //
analyzed: skye dang rga ba'i rjes su 'jug //
translated: They follow birth and aging.

original: gang tshe 'jig rten rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: gang tshe 'jig rten rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: When the perfect buddhas appear in the world,

original: lha mi phan par bzhed pa po //
analyzed: lha mi phan par bzhed pa po //
translated: Those who wish to benefit gods and humans,

original: spyan ldan nyon mongs las rgal ba //
analyzed: spyan ldan nyon mongs las rgal ba //
translated: Those who have eyes, who have crossed over the afflictions,

original: de bzhin gshegs rnams byung ba na //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs rnams byung ba na //
translated: The thus-gone ones,🔽The cessation of suffering,🔽The origin of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang // sdug bsngal kun du 'byung ba dang // sdug bsngal yang dag 'da' ba yi //🔽zhi ba mya ngan 'das 'gro ba'i //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang // sdug bsngal kun du 'byung ba dang // sdug bsngal yang dag 'da' ba yi // zhi ba mya ngan 'das 'gro ba'i //
translated: And the complete transcendence of suffering,🔽The path of the noble ones with eight branches

original: 'phags lam yan lag brgyad pa dag /
analyzed: 'phags lam yan lag brgyad pa dag /
translated: That leads to peace, to nirvāṇa,

original: sdug bsngal thams @270b cad 'gog pa'i chos //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams @270b cad 'gog pa'i chos //
translated: The Dharma that puts an end to all suffering,

original: nye bar ston byed de yi tshe //
analyzed: nye bar ston byed de yi tshe //
translated: At that time, the teacher of that

original: mi rtag mi rtag nyid du mthong //
analyzed: mi rtag mi rtag nyid du mthong //
translated: sees impermanence as impermanent.

original: sdug bsngal sdug bsngal nyid mthong ste //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sdug bsngal nyid mthong ste //
translated: He sees suffering as suffering,

original: bdag med pa la bdag med dang // mi gtsang mi gtsang nyid du rtogs //
analyzed: bdag med pa la bdag med dang // mi gtsang mi gtsang nyid du rtogs //
translated: and nonself as nonself, and the impure as impure.

original: de ni 'grub bde thob 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de ni 'grub bde thob 'gyur zhing //
translated: He attains the bliss of accomplishment

original: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan 'das//🔽'jigs pa thams cad las rgal zhing //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan 'das// 'jigs pa thams cad las rgal zhing //
translated: and nirvana in this very life.🔽He crosses over all fears

original: sred pa kun dang bral bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sred pa kun dang bral bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and becomes free from all craving.

original: mdo las kyang ji skad du zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: mdo las kyang ji skad du zhes bya ba la //
translated: As it is said in the sutra:

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Shravasti.

original: dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams te /
analyzed: dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams te /
translated: “Monks, these four are the noble truths.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang // sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang // sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: gang yang 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes shing 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba /
analyzed: gang yang 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes shing 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba /
translated: Moreover, noble śrāvakas who are learned, correctly know the ārya truth of suffering just as it is. They correctly know the origin of suffering,

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa /
translated: the cessation of suffering,

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mo zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /🔽des de'i tshe mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log de dag spong bar byed do / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba'o zhes bya ba dang / mi gtsang ba la gcang ba'o zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mo zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te / des de'i tshe mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log de dag spong bar byed do / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba'o zhes bya ba dang / mi gtsang ba la gcang ba'o zhes bya ba dang /
translated: and the path leading to the cessation of suffering just as it is.🔽At that time, they abandon the mistaken ideation, the mistaken mind, and the mistaken view that what is impermanent is permanent,🔽and they abandon the mistaken ideation, the mistaken mind, and the mistaken view that what is impure is pure,

original: bdag med pa la bdag go zhes 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log pa dag spong bar byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag med pa la bdag go zhes 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log pa dag spong bar byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: what is suffering is happiness, and what is selfless is a self.

original: gang yang mdo las gnas brtan kun dga' bos 'phags pa dag gi dbang phyug gi dbang du mdzad nas zhes bya ba la gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gang yang mdo las gnas brtan kun dga' bos 'phags pa dag gi dbang phyug gi dbang du mdzad nas zhes bya ba la gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzhed thogs nas phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong tshe dang ldan pa ngag gi dbang phyug dang lhan cig mnyan yod du bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzhed thogs nas phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong tshe dang ldan pa ngag gi dbang phyug dang lhan cig mnyan yod du bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs so //
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda, in the morning, taking his robes and bowl, entered Śrāvastī for alms along with the venerable Vāgīśa, a monk attendant.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ngag gi dbang phyug gis bud med kyi tshogs gzhon nu ma kha dog dang ldan pa dga' dga' lta bu gzhan dang gzhan dag mthong nas 'dod chags kyi @271a * //🔽sems skyes te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ngag gi dbang phyug gis bud med kyi tshogs gzhon nu ma kha dog dang ldan pa dga' dga' lta bu gzhan dang gzhan dag mthong nas 'dod chags kyi @271a * //🔽sems skyes te /
translated: Then the venerable Vāgīśa, seeing various young women’s groups, beautiful and attractive, generated a mind of desire.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ngag gi dbang phyug 'di snyam du bdag gis bud med kyi tshogs gzhon nu ma kha dog dang ldan pa dga' dga' lta bu gzhan dang gzhan dag mthong nas chags pa'i sems skyes pa ni bdag gis ma rnyed cing rnyed pa ma
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ngag gi dbang phyug 'di snyam du bdag gis bud med kyi tshogs gzhon nu ma kha dog dang ldan pa dga' dga' lta bu gzhan dang gzhan dag mthong nas chags pa'i sems skyes pa ni bdag gis ma rnyed cing rnyed pa ma
translated: Then the Venerable Vāgīśa thought, “I have seen other young women’s assemblies, who are like delightful, colorful paintings. The thought of desire arose in me, but I did not find what I had not found before.

original: yin la ngan pa rnyed kyis bzang po ma rnyed do snyam du rig nas /
analyzed: yin la ngan pa rnyed kyis bzang po ma rnyed do snyam du rig nas /
translated: I have found what is bad, but not what is good.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Having understood this, he said to the Venerable Ānanda:

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags zil non pas //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags zil non pas //
translated: “Overcome by desire and attachment,

original: sems ni yongs su gdungs par gyur //
analyzed: sems ni yongs su gdungs par gyur //
translated: my mind is completely tormented.

original: goo tam bdag la thugs brtse bas //
analyzed: goo tam bdag la thugs brtse bas //
translated: Gautama, out of compassion for me,

original: nye bar zhi ba'i thabs gsungs shig /'du shes phyin ci log pa yis //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba'i thabs gsungs shig /'du shes phyin ci log pa yis //
translated: please teach a method for pacification.”

original: khyod kyi sems ni yongs su gdungs //
analyzed: khyod kyi sems ni yongs su gdungs //
translated: “Your mind is completely tormented🔽by distorted perception.

original: sdug pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin spangs nas //
analyzed: sdug pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin spangs nas //
translated: Abandon grasping at the signs of beauty,

original: 'dod chags nye bar spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod chags nye bar spong bar 'gyur //
translated: and desire will be abandoned.

original: mi sdug bsgom la rtag tu khyod //
analyzed: mi sdug bsgom la rtag tu khyod //
translated: Always meditate on the unattractive,🔽and desire will be abandoned.”

original: rtse gcig legs par 'jog par gyis //
analyzed: rtse gcig legs par 'jog par gyis //
translated: You should settle one-pointedly well.

original: mi sdug me yis skams nas ni //
analyzed: mi sdug me yis skams nas ni //
translated: When you dry up with the fire of foulness,

original: yang dang yang du sreg mi 'gyur //
analyzed: yang dang yang du sreg mi 'gyur //
translated: you will not be burned again and again.

original: 'du byed dman pa nyid dang ni //
analyzed: 'du byed dman pa nyid dang ni //
translated: You see the inferiority of formations,

original: de bzhin sdug bsngal bdag med mthong //
analyzed: de bzhin sdug bsngal bdag med mthong //
translated: and likewise the selflessness of suffering.

original: lus su gtogs pa dran byas nas //
analyzed: lus su gtogs pa dran byas nas //
translated: Having mindfulness belonging to the body,

original: shin tu skyo ba mang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: shin tu skyo ba mang bar 'gyur //
translated: you will have much weariness.

original: mtshan ma med pa bsgom byas nas //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa bsgom byas nas //
translated: Having cultivated the signless,

original: nga rgyal phra rgyas zhi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nga rgyal phra rgyas zhi bar 'gyur //
translated: the subtle pride of the proclivity is pacified.

original: de nas nga rgyal mngon rtogs nas //
analyzed: de nas nga rgyal mngon rtogs nas //
translated: Then, having realized pride,

original: sdug bsngal tha mar byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tha mar byed par 'gyur //
translated: you will make suffering come to an end.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: phyi rol pa'i lta bar gyur pa rnams kyi nang na 'di nyid mchog yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i lta bar gyur pa rnams kyi nang na 'di nyid mchog yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Among the non-Buddhist views, this is the best.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag ngas mchog tu gdags pa bcu bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag ngas mchog tu gdags pa bcu bshad par bya ste /
translated: Monks, I will explain the ten supreme designations.

original: de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
translated: Listen to that well and keep it in mind, and I will explain it.

original: mchog tu gdags pa bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: mchog tu gdags pa bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten supreme designations?

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po sde rab tu pham byed ji srid du rang gi sa las rnam par rgyal te /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po sde rab tu pham byed ji srid du rang gi sa las rnam par rgyal te /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala was the most powerful of all the kings of the earth.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po sde rab tu pham byed ces gang du btags nas grags pa 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po sde rab tu pham byed ces gang du btags nas grags pa 'jug pa ste /
translated: He was called King Prasenajit of Kosala and was known as such.

original: sems can de dag rnams las ko sa la'i rgyal po mchog ces bya ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag rnams las ko sa la'i rgyal po mchog ces bya ste /
translated: Among all those beings, King Prasenajit of Kosala was the most powerful.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po sde rab tu pham byed de yang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba gzhan du srid pa ste /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po sde rab tu pham byed de yang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba gzhan du srid pa ste /
translated: But King Prasenajit of Kosala was impermanent, subject to change, and passed away.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dag 'di ltar rig nas de'i phyir skyo bar 'gyur zhing de la 'dod chags dang bral ba @271b dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba de las grol ba dang rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dag 'di ltar rig nas de'i phyir skyo bar 'gyur zhing de la 'dod chags dang bral ba @271b dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba de las grol ba dang rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: Noble disciples who have heard this will know this and become disenchanted with it. They will become free from desire for it, and through being free from desire, they will be liberated.

original: mchog la yang skyo bar 'gyur na dman pa la lta smos kyang ci zhig dgos te /
analyzed: mchog la yang skyo bar 'gyur na dman pa la lta smos kyang ci zhig dgos te /
translated: If they become disenchanted with the supreme, what need is there to mention the inferior?

original: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first designation of the supreme.

original: ji srid du nyi mas mun pa 'phrog cing phyogs snang bar byed pa de srid du stong gi 'jig rten zhes bya ste nyi ma stong dang zla ba stong dang ri'i rgyal po ri rab stong dang / shar gyi lus 'phags stong dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod stong dang /
analyzed: ji srid du nyi mas mun pa 'phrog cing phyogs snang bar byed pa de srid du stong gi 'jig rten zhes bya ste nyi ma stong dang zla ba stong dang ri'i rgyal po ri rab stong dang / shar gyi lus 'phags stong dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod stong dang /
translated: As long as the sun illuminates and illuminates the directions, it is called the world system of a thousand worlds. There are a thousand suns, a thousand moons, a thousand Sumeru kings of mountains, a thousand eastern Videha continents, a thousand western Godaniya continents,

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan stong dang / lho'i 'dzam bu gling stong dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris kyi lha stong dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed stong rnams dang /
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan stong dang / lho'i 'dzam bu gling stong dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris kyi lha stong dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed stong rnams dang /
translated: a thousand northern Kuru continents, a thousand southern Jambudvipa continents, a thousand Four Great Kings' heavens, a thousand Thirty-three heavens, a thousand Yāma heavens, a thousand Tuṣita heavens, a thousand Nirmāṇarati heavens, a thousand Paranirmitavaśavartin heavens,

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten stong rnams te /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten stong rnams te /
translated: and a thousand Brahma worlds.

original: 'di ni stong gi phyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni stong gi phyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the world system of a thousand worlds.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams de dag las tshangs pa stong gi bdag po ni mchog ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams de dag las tshangs pa stong gi bdag po ni mchog ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Among those world systems of a thousand worlds, the lord of a thousand Brahmās should be called supreme.

original: tshangs pa stong gi bdag po de yang mi rtag pa /
analyzed: tshangs pa stong gi bdag po de yang mi rtag pa /
translated: “Brahmā, lord of a thousand worlds, is impermanent,🔽subject to change,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and so on up to:

original: snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: what need is there to speak of inferior beings?

original: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: This is the second designation of the highest.”

original: dge slong dag 'jig rten 'di 'jig par 'gyur ba'i dus yod de /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'jig rten 'di 'jig par 'gyur ba'i dus yod de /
translated: “Monks, there is a time when this world disintegrates.

original: 'jig rten 'jig pa na sems can phal cher 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris su skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jig pa na sems can phal cher 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris su skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the world disintegrates, most sentient beings are reborn in the Ābhāsvara class of gods.

original: de dag de na gzugs can yid las byung ba dbang po ma nyams shing tshang ba /
analyzed: de dag de na gzugs can yid las byung ba dbang po ma nyams shing tshang ba /
translated: There they have mental bodies, complete with all their faculties.

original: yan lag dang nying lag thams cad dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag thams cad dang ldan pa /
translated: They are complete with all their major and minor body parts.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs legs pa /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs legs pa /
translated: They have good color and shape.

original: rang gi 'od can /
analyzed: rang gi 'od can /
translated: They have their own light.

original: nam mkha' la 'gro ba //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'gro ba //
translated: They move through space.

original: dga' ba za zhing dga' ba'i zas can /
analyzed: dga' ba za zhing dga' ba'i zas can /
translated: They eat and enjoy the pleasure of food.

original: tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas te /
analyzed: tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas te /
translated: They have long lives and remain for a long time.

original: 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris su skyes nas ring du ma lon pa'i lha de dag las 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris su skyes pa de dag mchog ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris su skyes nas ring du ma lon pa'i lha de dag las 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris su skyes pa de dag mchog ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: The gods who have been born in the realm of Abhasvara for a long time are said to be the best.

original: 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris su sngar skyes pa de rnams kyang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos te 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris su sngar skyes pa de rnams kyang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos te 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The gods who have been born in the realm of Abhasvara for a long time are said to be the best.

original: lam ni rnam pa bzhi ste /🔽mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba'i @272a * //🔽lam yang yod /🔽mngon par shes pa myur la dka' ba'i lam yang yod //
analyzed: lam ni rnam pa bzhi ste / mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba'i @272a * // lam yang yod / mngon par shes pa myur la dka' ba'i lam yang yod //
translated: The path is of four types:🔽there is a path of slow superknowledge and slow practice;

original: mngon par shes pa bul la sla ba'i lam yang yod //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa bul la sla ba'i lam yang yod //
translated: there is a path of slow superknowledge and quick practice;🔽there is a path of quick superknowledge and slow practice;

original: mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba'i lam yang yod de /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba'i lam yang yod de /
translated: there is a path of quick superknowledge and quick practice.

original: de dag las mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba'i lam 'di ni mchog ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag las mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba'i lam 'di ni mchog ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: The path of quick superknowledge and quick practice is said to be the best.

original: de bzhin du sgrub pa'i sems can rnams kyang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrub pa'i sems can rnams kyang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Likewise, the sentient beings who are practitioners are impermanent and subject to change.

original: snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: How much more so for those who are inferior.

original: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth designation of the supreme.

original: 'du shes ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'du shes ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of perceptions:

original: chung ngu dang lhan cig skye ba dang / rgya chen po dang / tshad med pa dang / cung zad med do zhes cung zad med pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: chung ngu dang lhan cig skye ba dang / rgya chen po dang / tshad med pa dang / cung zad med do zhes cung zad med pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: the perception of the small, the perception of the great, the perception of the infinite, and the perception of nothing whatsoever.

original: de dag las gang 'du shes ni cung zad kyang med do zhes cung zad med pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'du shes ni 'du shes 'di dag las mchog ces brjod par bya zhing /
analyzed: de dag las gang 'du shes ni cung zad kyang med do zhes cung zad med pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'du shes ni 'du shes 'di dag las mchog ces brjod par bya zhing /
translated: Among these, the perception of nothing whatsoever is said to be the supreme perception.🔽Likewise, the sentient beings who are without perception are impermanent and subject to change.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes med pa'i sems can de yang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba dang / snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes med pa'i sems can de yang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba dang / snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: How much more so for those who are inferior.

original: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth designation of the supreme.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The bases of subjugation are of eight types.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs cung du kha dog bzang po dang kha dog dan pa rnams la lta ba na gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan te shes /
analyzed: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs cung du kha dog bzang po dang kha dog dan pa rnams la lta ba na gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan te shes /
translated: When those who have the internal ideation of form see external forms that are small, beautiful, or ugly, they subjugate those forms and know them.

original: zil gyis mnan te mthong zhing 'di lta bu'i 'du shes can du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: zil gyis mnan te mthong zhing 'di lta bu'i 'du shes can du gyur pa ste /
