translated: They see them after subjugating them and have the ideation of that.

original: 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang po'o zhes sngar mdzod kyi gnas dang por bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang po'o zhes sngar mdzod kyi gnas dang por bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is the first base of subjugation.

original: de dag las gang gzugs med par 'du shes par phyi rol gyi gzugs dkar po dkar po lta bu ston pa 'od dkar po 'byung ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag las gang gzugs med par 'du shes par phyi rol gyi gzugs dkar po dkar po lta bu ston pa 'od dkar po 'byung ba 'di lta ste /
translated: From among those, those who have the ideation of the formless teach external forms that are white, like white color, and emit white light.

original: skar ma pa bsangs lta bu ste /
analyzed: skar ma pa bsangs lta bu ste /
translated: It is like the star Canopus.

original: zil gyis gnon a'i skye mched de dag las zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched 'di ni mchog ces brjod do //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon a'i skye mched de dag las zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched 'di ni mchog ces brjod do //
translated: From among those bases of subjugation, this base of subjugation is said to be supreme.

original: de bzhin du zil gyis gnon pa'i sems can de yang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du zil gyis gnon pa'i sems can de yang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Likewise, the sentient beings who are overcome by the power of the meditative absorption of the cessation of ideation and sensation are impermanent and subject to change.

original: snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: How much more so for those who are inferior?

original: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth designation of the supreme.

original: zad par gyi skye mched ni @272b rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched ni @272b rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: The bases of mastery are of ten kinds.

original: bcu gang zhe na /🔽zad par sa dang lhan cig skyes pa steng dang 'og dang logs su gnyis med cing tshad med pa zhes bya ba nas /🔽snga ma bzhin du zad par rnam par shes pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na / zad par sa dang lhan cig skyes pa steng dang 'og dang logs su gnyis med cing tshad med pa zhes bya ba nas / snga ma bzhin du zad par rnam par shes pa'i bar du ste /
translated: What are the ten?🔽The base of mastery of the totality-field of earth, which is not two, is infinite, and so on, up to the base of mastery of the totality-field of consciousness, which is not two, is infinite.

original: zad par gyi skye mched de dag las rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi zad par gyi steng dang 'og dang logs su gnyis med cing tshad med pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyi skye mched 'di ni mchog ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched de dag las rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi zad par gyi steng dang 'og dang logs su gnyis med cing tshad med pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyi skye mched 'di ni mchog ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Among these bases of mastery, the base of mastery of the totality-field of infinite consciousness is said to be supreme.

original: de bzhin du zad par gyi skye mched de la snyoms par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du zad par gyi skye mched de la snyoms par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Likewise, the sentient beings who have entered the meditative attainment of the bases of mastery are impermanent and changeable, and so on up to:

original: snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: what need is there to speak of those who are inferior?

original: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh designation of the supreme.

original: phyi rol pa'i lta bar gyur pa rnams kyi nang na mchog ni bdag 'byung bar ma gyur cig /
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i lta bar gyur pa rnams kyi nang na mchog ni bdag 'byung bar ma gyur cig /
translated: Among the views of non-Buddhists, the supreme is this: “May I not come to be.

original: bdag gi 'byung bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba 'di nyid mchog yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi 'byung bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba 'di nyid mchog yin te /
translated: May I not come to be.”

original: de bzhin du lta bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lta bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Likewise, the sentient beings who have entered the meditative attainment of the bases of totality are impermanent and changeable, and so on up to:

original: snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: what need is there to speak of those who are inferior?

original: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth designation of the supreme.

original: phyi rol pa'i gtsang zhing dag par smra ba rnams kyi rnams na mchog ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i gtsang zhing dag par smra ba rnams kyi rnams na mchog ni 'di yin te /
translated: Among the non-Buddhist proponents of purity, this is the supreme:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: mchog tu dag par smra bar btags pa srid pa'i rtse mo ste /
analyzed: mchog tu dag par smra bar btags pa srid pa'i rtse mo ste /
translated: The peak of existence is designated as the highest purity.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi 'du byed lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi 'du byed lhag ma'o //
translated: It is the formation of the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de bzhin du yongs su dag pa'i sems can de yang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du yongs su dag pa'i sems can de yang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Similarly, that completely pure sentient being is impermanent, undergoes change, and so on, up to

original: snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: it goes without saying that the inferior ones are also impermanent.

original: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa dgu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mchog tu gdags pa dgu pa'o //
translated: This is the ninth designation as highest.

original: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyi nang na mchog ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyi nang na mchog ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among those who attain nirvana in this very life, the highest is

original: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das par btags pa reg pa'i skye mched drug ma lus par spangs pa /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das par btags pa reg pa'i skye mched drug ma lus par spangs pa /
translated: the designation of attaining nirvana in this very life, the complete abandonment of the six bases of contact,

original: nges par spangs pa ;
analyzed: nges par spangs pa ;
translated: the definite abandonment,

original: byang bar gyur pa /
analyzed: byang bar gyur pa /
translated: the purification,

original: zad pa / 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa /
analyzed: zad pa / 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa /
translated: the exhaustion, the freedom from attachment, the cessation,

original: nye bar zhi ba /🔽nus pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba /🔽nus pa ste /
translated: the pacification,🔽and the termination of the six bases of contact.

original: de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems can de yang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems can de yang mi rtag pa yongs su 'gyur zhes bya ba nas /
translated: So too, the sentient being who has attained nirvana is impermanent and changes.

original: snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /🔽'di ni mchog @273a * //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar du ste / 'di ni mchog @273a * //
translated: And so on up to: What need is there to speak of the inferior?

original: tu gdags pa bcu pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tu gdags pa bcu pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is the tenth designation of the supreme.🔽The summary

original: bar sdom la /
analyzed: bar sdom la /
translated: is:🔽The defeat of the schools, Brahma,🔽perception, the path,🔽the bases of subjugation and totalization,

original: sde rab pham byed tshangs pa dang // 'od gsal lam du 'du shes dang // zil gnon zad par skye mched dang // lta ba rnam dag mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: sde rab pham byed tshangs pa dang // 'od gsal lam du 'du shes dang // zil gnon zad par skye mched dang // lta ba rnam dag mya ngan 'das //
translated: the view, purification, nirvana.

original: gang yang mdo las lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi 'byung zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang mdo las lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi 'byung zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, it is said in the sutras that there are fourteen undeclared topics.🔽The Dirgharigha sutra declares:🔽Monks, non Buddhist wanderers say:

original: lung ring po'i mdo dgu pa las dge slong dag gzhan mu stegs can kun du rgyu dag 'di skad du khyed cag gi dge sbyong goo ta ma 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug pa'o zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: lung ring po'i mdo dgu pa las dge slong dag gzhan mu stegs can kun du rgyu dag 'di skad du khyed cag gi dge sbyong goo ta ma 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug pa'o zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Your ascetic Gotama says that the world is permanent, this alone is the truth, the others are confused.

original: mi rtag pa go zhes bya ba dang / rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag ces bya ba dang / rtag pa yang ma yin pa mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba dang / mtha' dang bcas pa dang / mtha' med pa dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa go zhes bya ba dang / rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag ces bya ba dang / rtag pa yang ma yin pa mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba dang / mtha' dang bcas pa dang / mtha' med pa dang /
translated: that impermanence is understood, that it is permanent and also impermanent, that it is neither permanent nor impermanent, that it has an end, that it does not have an end,

original: mtha' dang bcas pa yang yin la mtha' med pa yang yin la zhes bya ba dang / mtha' dang bcas pa yang ma yin mtha' med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba dang / lus de nyid srog ces bya ba dang / lus las srog de bzhin no zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: mtha' dang bcas pa yang yin la mtha' med pa yang yin la zhes bya ba dang / mtha' dang bcas pa yang ma yin mtha' med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba dang / lus de nyid srog ces bya ba dang / lus las srog de bzhin no zhes bya ba dang /
translated: that it both has an end and does not have an end, that it neither has an end nor does not have an end, that the body is the life force, that the body is different from the life force,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod ces bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas med ces bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod kyang yod la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod ces bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas med ces bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod kyang yod la /
translated: that the Tathāgata exists after death, that the Tathāgata does not exist after death, that the Tathāgata both exists and does not exist after death,🔽 and that the Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist after death.

original: med kyang med ces bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ji ltar lung ston par byed ces 'dri bar 'gyur ba'i gnas yod do //
analyzed: med kyang med ces bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ji ltar lung ston par byed ces 'dri bar 'gyur ba'i gnas yod do //
translated: And how can you say The Tathāgata does not exist after death, nor does he both exist and not exist after death, nor does he neither exist nor not exist after death?

original: de la ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //🔽dge slong dag gang gi tshe gzhan mu stegs can kun du rgyu dag 'di skad du ci'i phyir //
analyzed: de la ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o // dge slong dag gang gi tshe gzhan mu stegs can kun du rgyu dag 'di skad du ci'i phyir //
translated: You should say No!🔽Monks, if non-Buddhist wanderers ask you, Why did the ascetic Gautama not prophesy in terms of one of these four possibilities?

original: khyed cag dge sbyong goo ta mas chos 'di dag phyogs gcig tu lung ma bstan ces 'dri na 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: khyed cag dge sbyong goo ta mas chos 'di dag phyogs gcig tu lung ma bstan ces 'dri na 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
translated: you should say to them:

original: 'di dag ni don la nye bar mi mkho ba /
analyzed: 'di dag ni don la nye bar mi mkho ba /
translated: These are not relevant to the goal,

original: chos la nye bar mi mkho ba /
analyzed: chos la nye bar mi mkho ba /
translated: not relevant to the Dhamma,

original: tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar mi mkho ba /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar mi mkho ba /
translated: not basic to the holy life.

original: mngon par shes pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mi sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mi sgrub pa ste /
translated: They do not lead to disenchantment, to dispassion, to cessation, to peace, to direct knowledge, to enlightenment, to Nibbāna.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis cha gcig tsam yang lung ma bstan to zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis cha gcig tsam yang lung ma bstan to zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Fortunate One has not declared any part of it.

original: dge slong dag gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyu dag 'di skad du khyed cag gi dge sbyong goo ta mas gzhan @273b cha shas ci zhig lung bstan ces 'dri na 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyu dag 'di skad du khyed cag gi dge sbyong goo ta mas gzhan @273b cha shas ci zhig lung bstan ces 'dri na 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, if the wandering sectarian philosophers ask you, ‘What part of the truth has the ascetic Gautama declared?’ you should answer them as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes phyogs gcig tu lung bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes phyogs gcig tu lung bstan to //
translated: ‘The Fortunate One has declared one part of the truth, saying, “This is the noble truth of suffering.”

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung //🔽'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung // 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa /
translated: He has declared one part of the truth, saying, “This is the origin of suffering.”🔽He has declared one part of the truth, saying, “This is the cessation of suffering.”

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis phyogs gcig tu long bstan to zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis phyogs gcig tu long bstan to zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: He has declared one part of the truth, saying, “This is the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.”’

original: dge slong dag gzhan mu stegs kun du rgyu dag 'di skad du ci'i phyir khyed cag gi dge sbyong goo ta mas chos 'di dag phyogs gcig tu lung bstan ces 'dri ba'i gnas yod la /
analyzed: dge slong dag gzhan mu stegs kun du rgyu dag 'di skad du ci'i phyir khyed cag gi dge sbyong goo ta mas chos 'di dag phyogs gcig tu lung bstan ces 'dri ba'i gnas yod la /
translated: Monks, there are non-Buddhist wanderers who ask, “Why did the ascetic Gautama propound these teachings in one place?”

original: de la 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
translated: You should respond to them as follows:

original: chos 'di dag ni don la nye bar mkho ba /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni don la nye bar mkho ba /
translated: “These teachings are useful for the meaning,

original: chos la nye bar mkho ba /
analyzed: chos la nye bar mkho ba /
translated: useful for the Dharma,

original: tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar mkho ba /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar mkho ba /
translated: useful for the holy life,

original: mngon par shes pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: and they accomplish the superknowledges, clear realizations, and nirvana.

original: de'i phyir ches 'di dag bcom ldan 'das kyis lung bstan to zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ches 'di dag bcom ldan 'das kyis lung bstan to zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One propounded these teachings.”

original: mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first is a definitive answer.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is Śrāvastī.

original: dris pa lung bstan pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dris pa lung bstan pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of definitive answers to questions:

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: mgo gcig tu dris pa lung bstan pa dang / rnam par phye ste dris pa lung bstan pa dang / dri ba dris te lung bstan pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa lung bstan pa'o //🔽mgo gcig lung bstan nyid dang ni //🔽rnam par phye ba de bzhin du gzhan //
analyzed: mgo gcig tu dris pa lung bstan pa dang / rnam par phye ste dris pa lung bstan pa dang / dri ba dris te lung bstan pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa lung bstan pa'o // mgo gcig lung bstan nyid dang ni // rnam par phye ba de bzhin du gzhan //
translated: The first is the answer that is a direct explanation.🔽The second is the answer that is an analysis.

original: dris pa lung stan pa gsum pa ste //
analyzed: dris pa lung stan pa gsum pa ste //
translated: The third is the answer that is a counter-question.

original: rnam pa gzhag pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhag pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the answer that is a classification.🔽The four kinds of answers are, respectively,

original: dris pa lung bstan bzhi po dag de dang de la go rims bzhin //
analyzed: dris pa lung bstan bzhi po dag de dang de la go rims bzhin //
translated: to be known in this way:🔽The monk who knows and speaks

original: 'di ltar shes shing smra ba dang // dge slong de nyid rig pa yin //🔽rtogs par dka' zhing bzod par dka' //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes shing smra ba dang // dge slong de nyid rig pa yin // rtogs par dka' zhing bzod par dka' //
translated: in this way is one who knows reality.🔽The Dharma is difficult to understand and difficult to see.

original: zab cing blta dka'i chos can yin //
analyzed: zab cing blta dka'i chos can yin //
translated: It is profound and appears contradictory.🔽The wise one, through right knowledge

original: mkhas pa don dang don min dang // gnyis ka yang dag rig pas na //🔽don min yongs su spong byed cing//
analyzed: mkhas pa don dang don min dang // gnyis ka yang dag rig pas na // don min yongs su spong byed cing//
translated: of what is meaningful and what is not,🔽completely abandons what is not meaningful

original: don du gyur pa yongs su 'dzin //
analyzed: don du gyur pa yongs su 'dzin //
translated: and completely takes up what is meaningful.

original: don mngon rtogs pa'i bstan pa de //
analyzed: don mngon rtogs pa'i bstan pa de //
translated: The teaching that makes the meaning clear

original: mkhas pa mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhas pa mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur //
translated: is for the wise one who will attain nirvana.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dge slong gzugs 'das pa zhig yod par ma gyur na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge slong gzugs 'das pa zhig yod par ma gyur na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If form of the past did not exist,

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: the context is Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag gzugs 'das pa dang ma 'ongs @274a * //
analyzed: dge slong dag gzugs 'das pa dang ma 'ongs @274a * //
translated: Monks, if form of the past and future

original: pa yang mi rtag na /
analyzed: pa yang mi rtag na /
translated: were impermanent,

original: da ltar byung ba lta smos kyang ci zhig dgos te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba lta smos kyang ci zhig dgos te /
translated: what need is there to mention the present?

original: dge slong dag 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'di ltar mthong ba dag 'das pa'i gzugs la btang snyoms su bya ba thob cing ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par mi dga' zhing da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la skyo ba dang 'dod chags dang bral
analyzed: dge slong dag 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'di ltar mthong ba dag 'das pa'i gzugs la btang snyoms su bya ba thob cing ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par mi dga' zhing da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la skyo ba dang 'dod chags dang bral
translated: Monks, noble disciples who are learned and possess this view attain equanimity with regard to past form, do not delight in future form, and with regard to present form, they are disgusted, free from attachment,

original: ba dang / 'gog pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba dang / 'gog pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and attain cessation.

original: dge slong dag gzugs 'das pa zhig med na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la btang snyoms su bya ba yang thob par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: dge slong dag gzugs 'das pa zhig med na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la btang snyoms su bya ba yang thob par mi 'gyur na /
translated: Monks, if form of the past did not exist, noble disciples who are learned would not attain equanimity with regard to past form.

original: gzugs 'das pa dag yod de /
analyzed: gzugs 'das pa dag yod de /
translated: Therefore, form of the past exists.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la btang snyoms su bya ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la btang snyoms su bya ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, noble disciples who are learned attain equanimity with regard to future form.

original: dge slong dag gal te gzugs ma 'ongs pa zhig med na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dag ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par mi dga' ba yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: dge slong dag gal te gzugs ma 'ongs pa zhig med na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dag ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par mi dga' ba yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: “Monks, if future form did not exist, then noble disciples who are learned would not have aversion toward future form.

original: gzugs ma 'ongs pa dag yod de /
analyzed: gzugs ma 'ongs pa dag yod de /
translated: But because future form exists,

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par mi dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par mi dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: noble disciples who are learned have aversion toward future form.

original: dge slong dag gal te gzugs da ltar byung ba zhig med na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dag da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la skye ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gag pa thob par yang mi 'gyur ba zhi ba na /
analyzed: dge slong dag gal te gzugs da ltar byung ba zhig med na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dag da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la skye ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gag pa thob par yang mi 'gyur ba zhi ba na /
translated: “Monks, if present form did not exist, then noble disciples who are learned would not attain the arising, the separation from attachment, and the cessation of present form.

original: gzugs da ltar byung ba dag yod de /
analyzed: gzugs da ltar byung ba dag yod de /
translated: But because present form exists,🔽noble disciples who are learned attain the arising, the separation from attachment, and the cessation of present form.”

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dag da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la skyo ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dag da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la skyo ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, noble disciples who have heard this will become disenchanted with, become dispassionate toward, and be liberated from present form, and they will attain liberation.

original: dge slong dag de bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa 'das pa zhig med na zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag de bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa 'das pa zhig med na zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
translated: “Monks, it is the same with feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness. If there were no past consciousness, monks, then a noble disciple who has heard this would not abandon passion for past consciousness.🔽Monks, if there were no future consciousness, then a noble disciple who has heard this would not abandon passion for future consciousness.🔽Monks, if there were no present consciousness, then a noble disciple who has heard this would not abandon passion for present consciousness.🔽Monks, if there were no past consciousness, then a noble disciple who has heard this would not attain equanimity toward past consciousness.🔽Monks, if there were no future consciousness, then a noble disciple who has heard this would not attain equanimity toward future consciousness.

original: dge slong dag 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dag 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa la btang snyoms su bya ba thob par yang mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dag 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa la btang snyoms su bya ba thob par yang mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Monks, if there were no present consciousness, then a noble disciple who has heard this would not attain equanimity toward present consciousness.”

original: gnyis pa brten te rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba skye mched drug gi dbang po'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa brten te rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba skye mched drug gi dbang po'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The second verse on the topic of the six sense bases, the chapter on the faculties, is

original: reg pa dang ming dang 'dod pa dang // bag med pa ni gnyis dag dang / zhes bya ba'i mdo gnyis @274b par bstan pa dag mdzod kyi gnas gsum par /
analyzed: reg pa dang ming dang 'dod pa dang // bag med pa ni gnyis dag dang / zhes bya ba'i mdo gnyis @274b par bstan pa dag mdzod kyi gnas gsum par /
translated: The two pairs taught in the sutra are written in the third chapter of the Abhidharmakośa:

original: reg drug 'dus te 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: reg drug 'dus te 'byung ba yin //
translated: The six contacts arise from the union of three.

original: zhes bya ba dang / chos gsum po 'di dag 'brel zhing 'dus la tshogs pa'o zhes bya ba der bris pa ba lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / chos gsum po 'di dag 'brel zhing 'dus la tshogs pa'o zhes bya ba der bris pa ba lta bar bya'o //
translated: And: These three factors are related, united, and combined.

original: gang yang kun du rgyu thor tshugs can rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang kun du rgyu thor tshugs can rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, with reference to the matted-hair ascetics, the sutra says:

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab kyi smyug ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab kyi smyug ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana near Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rgyal po'i khab bya rgod phung po'i ri la brten cing gnas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rgyal po'i khab bya rgod phung po'i ri la brten cing gnas so //
translated: At that time, the venerable Śāriputra was dwelling and living on the Vulture Peak mountain near Rājagṛha.

original: de nas bram ze kun du rgyu thor tshugs can mang po tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang na ba der nye bar 'ongs te /
analyzed: de nas bram ze kun du rgyu thor tshugs can mang po tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang na ba der nye bar 'ongs te /
translated: Then many matted-hair ascetics, brahmins, and wandering mendicants approached the venerable Śāriputra.

original: nye bar 'ongs nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang lhan cig yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / bde bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: nye bar 'ongs nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang lhan cig yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / bde bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Having approached, they sat down to one side and conversed with the venerable Śāriputra with various kinds of pleasant and joyful speech.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas de nas kun du rgyu thor tshugs can mang po de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas de nas kun du rgyu thor tshugs can mang po de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: After they had sat down to one side, the many wandering mendicants with topknots said this to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: sh'a ri'i bu khyod cag gi ston pa ci zhig smra zhing ci zhig 'chad par byed /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu khyod cag gi ston pa ci zhig smra zhing ci zhig 'chad par byed /
translated: “Śāriputra, what does your teacher say, what does he teach?”

original: nga'i ston pa 'di skad du smra zhing 'di skad du 'chad de /
analyzed: nga'i ston pa 'di skad du smra zhing 'di skad du 'chad de /
translated: “My teacher says this, teaches this:

original: kha cig gis byas shing nya bar bsags na de'i rgyu dang de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig ste shi ma thag tu dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba'i mtshams med pa'i las ni lnga po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: kha cig gis byas shing nya bar bsags na de'i rgyu dang de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig ste shi ma thag tu dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba'i mtshams med pa'i las ni lnga po 'di dag ste /
translated: ‘If one does and accumulates some things, by that cause and that condition, when the body breaks up, immediately after death, one is born in the hells. There are five actions with immediate results:

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: pha gsod pa dang / ma gsod pa dang / dgra bcom pa gsod pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa rnams so //
analyzed: pha gsod pa dang / ma gsod pa dang / dgra bcom pa gsod pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa rnams so //
translated: killing one’s mother, killing one’s father, killing an arhat, creating a schism in the Saṅgha, and with evil intent drawing blood from a Tathāgata.

original: sh'a ri'i bu ci las 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba yongs su gyur pa dag med na bsams bzhin du pha dang ma dang dgra bcom pa srog dang bral ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa dag de'i rgyu dang de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig ste shi ma thag tu sems can dmyal bar skye ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu ci las 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba yongs su gyur pa dag med na bsams bzhin du pha dang ma dang dgra bcom pa srog dang bral ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa dag de'i rgyu dang de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig ste shi ma thag tu sems can dmyal bar skye ba'i gnas med do //
translated: “Śāriputra, if the past, future, and present were not nonexistent, ceased, stopped, and transformed, then it would be impossible for one to intentionally kill one’s mother, kill one’s father, kill an arhat, create a schism in the Saṅgha, or with evil intent draw blood from a Tathāgata. Because of that cause and that condition, it would be impossible for one’s body to be destroyed and immediately after death be reborn in the hells.

original: de nas bram ze kun du rgyu thor tshugs can de dag tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bshad pa lam mngon par dga' bar yang mi byed /
analyzed: de nas bram ze kun du rgyu thor tshugs can de dag tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bshad pa lam mngon par dga' bar yang mi byed /
translated: ” Then those wandering brahmins with topknots, having heard what the venerable Śāriputra had said, neither approved nor rejected it.

original: khro bar mi byed par stan las langs te song ngo //
analyzed: khro bar mi byed par stan las langs te song ngo //
translated: They rose from their seats and left.

original: @275a * // de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu kun du rgyu thor tshugs can de dag song nas ring po ma lon par bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: @275a * // de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu kun du rgyu thor tshugs can de dag song nas ring po ma lon par bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: Then, not long after the matted-hair ascetics had left, the venerable Śāriputra went to the Blessed One.

original: nye bar song nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: nye bar song nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Having approached, he sat down to one side,

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bram ze kun du rgyu thor tshugs can rnams dang lhan cig gtam gzhan brjod pa ci ltar gyur ba de thams cad rgyas par bcom ldan 'das la gsol te //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bram ze kun du rgyu thor tshugs can rnams dang lhan cig gtam gzhan brjod pa ci ltar gyur ba de thams cad rgyas par bcom ldan 'das la gsol te //
translated: and the venerable Śāriputra told the Blessed One in detail what he had discussed with the matted-hair ascetics.

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When he had finished speaking thus, the Blessed One said to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: sh'a ri'i bu bram ze kun du rgyu thor tshugs can de dag gis ma bsams shing rjes su mi mthun pa so sor brtags pa'i tshig smras te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu bram ze kun du rgyu thor tshugs can de dag gis ma bsams shing rjes su mi mthun pa so sor brtags pa'i tshig smras te /
translated: Śāriputra, those matted-hair ascetics, brahmins, spoke words that were not well-considered, not in accord, and not well-examined.

original: byis pa rmongs pa mi gsal ba mi mkhas par 'di skad du las gang 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba yongs su gyur pa de dag ni med do //
analyzed: byis pa rmongs pa mi gsal ba mi mkhas par 'di skad du las gang 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba yongs su gyur pa de dag ni med do //
translated: The ignorant, confused, unwise, and unskillful say, ‘Those actions that have passed, ceased, changed, and perished do not exist.

original: 'di na kha cig gis pha dang ma dang dgra bcom pa bsams bzhin du srog dang bral ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa dag de'i rgyu dang de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig ma thag kho nar sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do zhes nga mi smra'o //
analyzed: 'di na kha cig gis pha dang ma dang dgra bcom pa bsams bzhin du srog dang bral ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa dag de'i rgyu dang de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig ma thag kho nar sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do zhes nga mi smra'o //
translated: I do not say that it is impossible and there is no chance that someone who has intentionally deprived their father, mother, or an arhat of life, caused a schism in the saṅgha, or maliciously drawn blood from a tathāgata will, due to those causes and conditions, immediately after the breakup of their body, be born in hell.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Śāriputra, why is that?

original: las gang 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba rnam par 'gyur pa de dag ni yod de /
analyzed: las gang 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba rnam par 'gyur pa de dag ni yod de /
translated: Those actions that have passed, ceased, changed, and perished do exist.

original: med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not nonexistent.

original: 'di na kha cig gis pha dang ma dang dgra bcom pa bsams bzhin du srog dang bral ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa dag de'i rgyu dang de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig ma thag kho nar sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di na kha cig gis pha dang ma dang dgra bcom pa bsams bzhin du srog dang bral ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa dag de'i rgyu dang de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig ma thag kho nar sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, some people, having intentionally deprived their father or mother or an arhat of life, having caused a schism in the Saṅgha, having with evil intent caused blood to flow from the body of a Tathāgata, immediately after the breakup of the body are reborn in hell.

original: sh'a ri'i bu gang gi phyir las gang 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba yongs su gyur pa de dag ni yod cing med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gang gi phyir las gang 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba yongs su gyur pa de dag ni yod cing med pa ma yin te /
translated: Śāriputra, because of that, whatever karma has been performed, whether it is exhausted or not, whether it has ceased or not, whether it has been transformed or not, it exists and is not nonexistent.

original: 'di na kha cig gis pha dang ma dang dgra bcom pa bsams bzhin du srog dang phral ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa dag lus zhig ma thag kho nar sems can dmyal bar @275b skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di na kha cig gis pha dang ma dang dgra bcom pa bsams bzhin du srog dang phral ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa dag lus zhig ma thag kho nar sems can dmyal bar @275b skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, some people, having intentionally deprived their father or mother or an arhat of life, having caused a schism in the Saṅgha, having with evil intent caused blood to flow from the body of a Tathāgata, immediately after the breakup of the body are reborn in hell.

original: sh'a ri'i bu las gang 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba yongs su gyur pa de dag ni yod la med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu las gang 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba yongs su gyur pa de dag ni yod la med pa ma yin te /
translated: “Śāriputra, those actions that have been performed and accumulated will not disappear without having issued their effects, whether they be pleasant or painful.

original: 'di na kha cig gis lus kyi log pa'i lam dang ngag dang yid kyi log pa'i lam dag thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di na kha cig gis lus kyi log pa'i lam dang ngag dang yid kyi log pa'i lam dag thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, some people will attain the wrong path of body, speech, and mind.

original: sh'a ri'i bu las gang 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba rnam par gyur pa de dag ni yod de /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu las gang 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba rnam par gyur pa de dag ni yod de /
translated: Śāriputra, those actions that have been performed and accumulated will not disappear without having issued their effects, whether they be pleasant or painful.

original: de'i phyir 'di na kha cig lus kyi log pa'i lam dang ngag dang yid kyi log pa'i lam dag thog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di na kha cig lus kyi log pa'i lam dang ngag dang yid kyi log pa'i lam dag thog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, here, some people will attain the wrong path of body, speech, and mind.

original: sh'a ri'i bu las gang zad pa 'gags pa bral ba rnam par gyur pa de dag ni yod la med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu las gang zad pa 'gags pa bral ba rnam par gyur pa de dag ni yod la med pa ma yin te /
translated: Śāriputra, those actions that have been performed and accumulated will not disappear without having issued their effects, whether they be pleasant or painful.

original: 'di na kha cig lus kyis nyes par spyod pa dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes pa spyod pa dag lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song 'gro log pa ltung ba sems can dmyal bar skyes bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di na kha cig lus kyis nyes par spyod pa dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes pa spyod pa dag lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song 'gro log pa ltung ba sems can dmyal bar skyes bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, some people, having engaged in misconduct with their body, speech, and mind, when their body breaks up and they die, will fall into a bad realm of existence and be born in the hells.

original: de'i phyir las 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba gyur pa de dag yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir las 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba gyur pa de dag yod do //
translated: Therefore, those past actions that have been exhausted, ceased, and changed are existent.

original: sh'a ri'i bu las 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba la 'gags pa yongs su gyur pa de dag ni yod lam med pa la ma yin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu las 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral ba la 'gags pa yongs su gyur pa de dag ni yod lam med pa la ma yin te /
translated: Śāriputra, those past actions that have been exhausted, ceased, and changed are existent, not nonexistent.

original: 'di na kha cig lus kyis legs par spyod pa dang / ngag dang yid kyi legs par spyod pa dag lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skyes bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di na kha cig lus kyis legs par spyod pa dang / ngag dang yid kyi legs par spyod pa dag lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skyes bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, some people, by means of physical, verbal, and mental good conduct, after the body’s destruction and death, are reborn in a happy realm, in a celestial world.

original: de'i phyir las 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral bar gyur pa de dag yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir las 'das pa zad pa 'gags pa bral bar gyur pa de dag yod do //
translated: Therefore, those past actions that have been exhausted, ceased, and changed are existent.🔽In the Sūtra on the Emptiness of the Ultimate,

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi mdo las zhes bya ba la skye mched drug gi mdo las /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi mdo las zhes bya ba la skye mched drug gi mdo las /
translated: in the Sūtra on the Six Sense Bases,

original: bsdus pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bdun pa las te /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bdun pa las te /
translated: in the second verse of the summary, in the seventh verse of the summary,

original: 'di nyid kyi mdzod kyi gnas gsum par /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi mdzod kyi gnas gsum par /
translated: in the third chapter of this Treasury,

original: bdag med phung po tsam nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med phung po tsam nyid do //
translated: it says, “The self is just the aggregates.”

original: zhes bya ba'i 'grel par ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis las kyi ni yod //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i 'grel par ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis las kyi ni yod //
translated: The commentary on that passage should be consulted.🔽The Bhagavān wrote, “Karma exists,

original: rnam par smin pa yod de zhes bya ba bris par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yod de zhes bya ba bris par blta bar bya'o //
translated: and its ripening exists.”

original: gang yang byang chub sems dpa' ji skad du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang byang chub sems dpa' ji skad du zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, the bodhisattva, as it is said,

original: lung ring po ting nge 'dzin dang yang dag par ldan pa'i mdo dang dang po las 'don te /
analyzed: lung ring po ting nge 'dzin dang yang dag par ldan pa'i mdo dang dang po las 'don te /
translated: recites the long scriptures, the sūtras endowed with samādhi, from the beginning.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi lan gnyis kyi bar du tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa la bos te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi lan gnyis kyi bar du tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa la bos te /
translated: Then, the Bhagavān addressed the venerable Aniruddha up to the second time,

original: ma 'gags pa khyed cag lhan cig 'dus te tshogs nas @276a * //
analyzed: ma 'gags pa khyed cag lhan cig 'dus te tshogs nas @276a * //
translated: “Aniruddha, you all gathered together and assembled,

original: gnas pa rnams mi'i chos bla ma cung zad cig shes pa yod cing /
analyzed: gnas pa rnams mi'i chos bla ma cung zad cig shes pa yod cing /
translated: and you who abide know a little of the higher knowledge of humans,

original: 'phags pa'i khyad par rtogs la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i khyad par rtogs la /
translated: and you realize the special qualities of the āryas,

original: shes pa dang mthong ba la rig nas gnas sam /
analyzed: shes pa dang mthong ba la rig nas gnas sam /
translated: and you abide knowing and seeing.

original: btsun pa de bzhin te bdag cag 'dus te tshogs shing 'dug pa rnams mi'i chos bla ma cung zad shes pa yod cing 'phags pa'i khyad par rtogs la shes pa dang mthong ba la reg nas gnas pa na gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba gcig yang dag par shes
analyzed: btsun pa de bzhin te bdag cag 'dus te tshogs shing 'dug pa rnams mi'i chos bla ma cung zad shes pa yod cing 'phags pa'i khyad par rtogs la shes pa dang mthong ba la reg nas gnas pa na gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba gcig yang dag par shes
translated: When we are dwelling in that way, we know one appearance of seeing forms.

original: la / de la gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba de myur du nub bar gyur te /🔽btsun pa bdag gis gzugs mthong zhing shes pa de'i rgyu mtshan legs par yid la byas te rtogs par nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: la / de la gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba de myur du nub bar gyur te / btsun pa bdag gis gzugs mthong zhing shes pa de'i rgyu mtshan legs par yid la byas te rtogs par nus pa ma yin la /
translated: That appearance of seeing forms quickly disappears.🔽Venerable, I am not able to understand the reason for that appearance of seeing forms.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan yang legs par yid la byas te gzung bar mi nus la /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan yang legs par yid la byas te gzung bar mi nus la /
translated: I am not able to grasp the reason for that appearance of seeing forms.

original: gang las gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba de nub pa'i rgyu mtshan yang mi shes so //
analyzed: gang las gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba de nub pa'i rgyu mtshan yang mi shes so //
translated: I do not know the reason for the disappearance of that appearance of seeing forms.”🔽“

original: ma 'gags pa de'i phyir gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba de rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan legs par yid la gyis shig / de'i rgyu mtshan yang legs par yid la gyis shig / rgyu mtshan gang gis gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba de nub par gyur pa yang legs
analyzed: ma 'gags pa de'i phyir gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba de rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan legs par yid la gyis shig / de'i rgyu mtshan yang legs par yid la gyis shig / rgyu mtshan gang gis gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba de nub par gyur pa yang legs
translated: You should properly keep in mind the reason why the appearance of seeing form will disappear.

original: par yid la gyis shig / ma 'gags pa nga yang sngon rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par ma rtogs pa na gzugs kyi snang ba gcig yang dag par shes shing mthong ste /
analyzed: par yid la gyis shig / ma 'gags pa nga yang sngon rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par ma rtogs pa na gzugs kyi snang ba gcig yang dag par shes shing mthong ste /
translated: Aniruddha, before I fully realized perfect awakening, I knew and saw the appearance of the form of a single form.

original: gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba de myur du nub par gyur to //
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba de myur du nub par gyur to //
translated: The appearance of seeing form quickly disappeared.

original: ma 'gags pa de la nga 'di snyam du gyur te ci bdag gis gzugs kyi snang ba yang dag par shes shing mthong ba de yod pa zhig gam /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa de la nga 'di snyam du gyur te ci bdag gis gzugs kyi snang ba yang dag par shes shing mthong ba de yod pa zhig gam /
translated: Aniruddha, I thought this: ‘Is the appearance of the form that I knew and saw existent?

original: 'on te med pa zhig / bdag gis gzugs mthong ba de yang yod pa zhig gam 'on te med pa zhig / de la bdag 'di snyam du gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te med pa zhig / bdag gis gzugs mthong ba de yang yod pa zhig gam 'on te med pa zhig / de la bdag 'di snyam du gyur te /
translated: I thought this:

original: gang yang 'jig rten na med pa gang yin pa de ni bdag gis shes pa 'am mthong ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten na med pa gang yin pa de ni bdag gis shes pa 'am mthong ba'i gnas med do //
translated: “Whatever does not exist in the world is not a basis for my knowledge or seeing.

original: yod pa gang yin pa de bdag la snang zhing yang dag par shes kyi /
analyzed: yod pa gang yin pa de bdag la snang zhing yang dag par shes kyi /
translated: Whatever exists, that appears to me and is correctly known by me.

original: med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not non-existent.

original: gzugs yod pa gang yin pa de mthong gi / med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs yod pa gang yin pa de mthong gi / med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Whatever form exists, that is seen by me. It is not non-existent.

original: ma 'gags pa de la nga 'di snyam du gyur @276b te ;
analyzed: ma 'gags pa de la nga 'di snyam du gyur @276b te ;
translated: Regarding that which is not ceased, I thought this:

original: ci bdag gi sems la nye ba'i nyon mongs byung bas gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba de nub par gyur to //
analyzed: ci bdag gi sems la nye ba'i nyon mongs byung bas gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba de nub par gyur to //
translated: “Has the appearance of seeing form been obscured by the arising of a minor affliction in my mind?

original: de nas yang nga 'di snyam du bdag gi sems la the tshom gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa skyes te /
analyzed: de nas yang nga 'di snyam du bdag gi sems la the tshom gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa skyes te /
translated: Then I thought this: ‘A minor affliction of doubt arose in my mind.

original: the tshom gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de sgrib pa'i rgyu yin zhing ting nge 'dzin 'pho bar byed pa mig nyams par byed pa gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba nub par byed pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: the tshom gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de sgrib pa'i rgyu yin zhing ting nge 'dzin 'pho bar byed pa mig nyams par byed pa gzugs mthong ba'i snang ba nub par byed pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This secondary affliction of doubt is the cause of obscuration, it causes the loss of concentration, it causes the loss of vision, it causes the disappearance of the appearance of forms.

original: dge slong dag tshur shog ngas nang gdams na nub khyad par du 'gro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge slong dag tshur shog ngas nang gdams na nub khyad par du 'gro zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Come, monks, when I give instruction in the evening, you will make progress in the morning.”

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag chos gang dag lhag par mos pa'i gnas mngon sum du byas pa de dang de dag mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa ni mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen to //
analyzed: dge slong dag chos gang dag lhag par mos pa'i gnas mngon sum du byas pa de dang de dag mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa ni mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen to //
translated: Monks, the Tathāgata, who has fearlessness, knows that whatever phenomena you have conviction in, and have made the basis for clear knowledge, you will engage in order to actualize them.

original: nga'i nyan thos sgyu dang g-yo med cing drang la drang po'i rang bzhin can dag tshur shog / ngas gdams pa dang / ngas rjes su bstan pa dang / ngas chos dag bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos sgyu dang g-yo med cing drang la drang po'i rang bzhin can dag tshur shog / ngas gdams pa dang / ngas rjes su bstan pa dang / ngas chos dag bstan par bya ste /
translated: “Come, my disciples, who are without deceit and hypocrisy, who are honest and of honest character. I will instruct you, I will teach you the Dharma, I will show you the path to heaven and to liberation.

original: nang par gdams na dgongs ka khyad par du 'gro zhing dgongs ka gdams na nad par khyad par du 'gro ste /
analyzed: nang par gdams na dgongs ka khyad par du 'gro zhing dgongs ka gdams na nad par khyad par du 'gro ste /
translated: If you give advice in the morning, it will be better in the evening. If you give advice in the evening, it will be better in the morning.

original: de ji ltar khyad par can gyi chos yang dag par rtogs pa na yod pa yang yod par shes /
analyzed: de ji ltar khyad par can gyi chos yang dag par rtogs pa na yod pa yang yod par shes /
translated: When you have realized the excellent Dharma, you will know that what exists is existent,

original: med pa yang med par shes /
analyzed: med pa yang med par shes /
translated: and that what does not exist is nonexistent.

original: bla ma dang bcas pa la bla ma dang bcas par shes /
analyzed: bla ma dang bcas pa la bla ma dang bcas par shes /
translated: You will know that what has a superior is that which has a superior,

original: bla na med pa la bla na med par shes /
analyzed: bla na med pa la bla na med par shes /
translated: and that what is unsurpassed is unsurpassed.

original: gang yang shes par bya ba dang / mthong bar bya ba dang / mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / thob par bya ba de thams cad shes pa dang mthong bar 'gyur ba'i gnas yod do //
analyzed: gang yang shes par bya ba dang / mthong bar bya ba dang / mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / thob par bya ba de thams cad shes pa dang mthong bar 'gyur ba'i gnas yod do //
translated: There is a basis for knowing, seeing, realizing, and attaining all that is to be known, seen, realized, and attained.

original: dge slong dag slob pa'i stobs rnam pa lnga dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs ni rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag slob pa'i stobs rnam pa lnga dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs ni rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: “Monks, there are five kinds of the power of training and ten kinds of the power of the Tathāgata.

original: slob pa'i rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: slob pa'i rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five kinds of the power of training?

original: dad pa slob pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / ngo tsha shes pa'i stobs dang / khrel yod pa'i stobs dang / shes rab slob pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: dad pa slob pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / ngo tsha shes pa'i stobs dang / khrel yod pa'i stobs dang / shes rab slob pa'i stobs so //
translated: the power of training in faith, the power of training in diligence, the power of training in shame, the power of training in embarrassment, and the power of training in wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten powers of the Tathāgata?

original: dge slong dag 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas gnas la gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa la gnas ma yin pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin @277a * //🔽rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas gnas la gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa la gnas ma yin pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin @277a * // rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Here, bhikṣus, the Tathāgata, through the destruction of the taints,🔽realizes for himself with direct insight the taint-free liberation of mind and liberation by wisdom, in this very life, having directly experienced and attained it for himself.

original: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pas gnas yin pa la gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa la gnas ma yin pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen pa 'di ni gang dang yang dag par ldan na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su
analyzed: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pas gnas yin pa la gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa la gnas ma yin pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen pa 'di ni gang dang yang dag par ldan na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su
translated: He fully understands: ‘These are the constituents of wholesome action.

original: dam 'cha' zhing tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor ba la 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang bo'o //

translated: The first power of the Tathāgata is the proclamation of the lion’s roar in the assembly, having taken a vow and turned the wheel of Brahmā.

original: rgyas par dge slong dag zag pa zad pa'i stobs ni mnyam par gzhag pa yin gyi mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni ma yin no zhes nga smra'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rgyas par dge slong dag zag pa zad pa'i stobs ni mnyam par gzhag pa yin gyi mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni ma yin no zhes nga smra'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Monks, I say that the power of knowledge regarding the absorptions, liberations, concentrations, and attainments is in equipoise, not in a nonequipoised state.🔽Monks, I say that the power of knowledge regarding the recollection of former existences is in equipoise, not in a nonequipoised state.🔽Monks, I say that the power of knowledge regarding death and rebirth is in equipoise, not in a nonequipoised state.🔽Monks, I say that the power of knowledge regarding the termination of the outflows is in equipoise, not in a nonequipoised state.

original: dge slong dag ting nge 'dzin ni lam ste ting nge 'dzin ma yin pa ni lam ngan pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag ting nge 'dzin ni lam ste ting nge 'dzin ma yin pa ni lam ngan pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Monks, I say that meditative absorption is the path, and non-meditative absorption is a bad path.”

original: bram ze thams cad yod ces bya ba ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bram ze thams cad yod ces bya ba ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Brahmins Say “Everything Exists”

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The Setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas bram ze rang bzhin nyan bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: de nas bram ze rang bzhin nyan bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: Then the Brahmin nature-listener went to the place where the Blessed One was.

original: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par bde bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par bde bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Having approached, they sat down to one side and had various pleasant and joyful conversations with the Blessed One.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas bram ze rang bzhin nyan gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas bram ze rang bzhin nyan gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: After sitting down to one side, the Brahmin Shroṇaka said to the Blessed One:

original: goo ta ma dris pa lung bstan pa'i phyir skabs 'byed na bdag phyogs bcud zad cig 'dri'o //
analyzed: goo ta ma dris pa lung bstan pa'i phyir skabs 'byed na bdag phyogs bcud zad cig 'dri'o //
translated: Gautama, if you would grant me the opportunity to ask a question, I would like to ask about something.

original: bram ze ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du dris shig dang lung bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: bram ze ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du dris shig dang lung bstan par bya'o //
translated: Brahmin, ask as you wish, and I will answer.

original: goo ta ma thams cad yod ces bya ba na goo ta ma thams cad yod ces bya ba gang yin /
analyzed: goo ta ma thams cad yod ces bya ba na goo ta ma thams cad yod ces bya ba gang yin /
translated: Gautama, when it is said 'everything exists,' what is meant by 'everything exists'?

original: bram ze de'i phyir khyod nyid la dri bar bya ste ji ltar bzod pa de bzhin du lan thob cig bram ze 'di ci snyam du sems /
analyzed: bram ze de'i phyir khyod nyid la dri bar bya ste ji ltar bzod pa de bzhin du lan thob cig bram ze 'di ci snyam du sems /
translated: Brahmin, for that reason I will ask you in return. Answer as you understand it. Brahmin, what do you think?

original: mig yod dam /
analyzed: mig yod dam /
translated: Do the eyes exist?

original: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
translated: Gautama, they do.

original: gzugs yod dam /
analyzed: gzugs yod dam /
translated: Do forms exist?

original: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
translated: “Gautama, they do exist.”

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa yod dam /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa yod dam /
translated: “Is there eye consciousness?”

original: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
translated: “Gautama, it exists.”

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa yod dam /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa yod dam /
translated: “Is there eye contact?”

original: goo ta ma mchis lags @279b so ;
analyzed: goo ta ma mchis lags @279b so ;
translated: “Gautama, it exists.”
