analyzed: / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa yod dam /
translated: “Is there a feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact, which may be pleasant, painful, or neither painful nor pleasant?”

original: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
translated: “Gautama, it exists.”

original: bram ze 'di ci snyam du sems /
analyzed: bram ze 'di ci snyam du sems /
translated: “Brahmin, what do you think?

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yod dam /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yod dam /
translated: “Are there ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind?”

original: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
translated: “Gautama, they exist.”

original: chos yod dam /
analyzed: chos yod dam /
translated: “Are there phenomena?”

original: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
translated: “Gautama, they exist.”

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod dam /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod dam /
translated: “Is there mind consciousness?”

original: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
translated: “Gautama, it exists.”

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa yod dam /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa yod dam /
translated: “Is there mind contact?”

original: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
translated: “Gautama, it exists.”

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa yod dam /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa yod dam /
translated: Is there a feeling that arises from the condition of contact with mental faculty?

original: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: goo ta ma mchis lags so //
translated: Gautama, it exists.

original: bram ze 'di dag ni thams cad yod ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: bram ze 'di dag ni thams cad yod ces bya ba ste /
translated: Brahmin, these are called “theists.”

original: bram ze gang kha cig 'di skad du dge sbyong goo ta mas thams cad yod do zhes bstan pa de spangs te ngas rnam pa gzhan du thams cad yod pa'o zhes bstan par bya'o zhes smra ba'i tshig tsam du dris pa'i lan mi shes shing dris pa'i lam
analyzed: bram ze gang kha cig 'di skad du dge sbyong goo ta mas thams cad yod do zhes bstan pa de spangs te ngas rnam pa gzhan du thams cad yod pa'o zhes bstan par bya'o zhes smra ba'i tshig tsam du dris pa'i lan mi shes shing dris pa'i lam
translated: Brahmin, some say, “The ascetic Gautama teaches that everything exists. I will refute that and teach that everything exists in a different way.” They do not know how to answer the question, “What is the meaning of the question?”

original: la mgo rmongs pa skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: la mgo rmongs pa skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: They generate confusion about the path of the question.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ji ltar yang de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yang de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not their domain.

original: de nas bram ze rang bzhin nyan bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rangs nas stan las langs te song ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bram ze rang bzhin nyan bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rangs nas stan las langs te song ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Then the brahmin by nature a listener rejoiced in and praised the words of the Blessed One and rose from his seat and left.

original: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the application of desire?

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bos te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bos te /
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the monks:

original: dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni sbyor ba ste /
translated: “Monks, there are four applications:

original: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang / srid pa'i sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang / srid pa'i sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: the application of desire, the application of striving, the application of view, and the application of ignorance.

original: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the application of desire?

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa dag 'dod pa rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes te /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa dag 'dod pa rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes te /
translated: Foolish ordinary beings who are not learned do not understand as it truly is the origin of desire, its disappearance, its satisfaction, its drawbacks, and the escape from them.

original: de 'dod pa rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang nges @280a * //🔽par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mi shes pa 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang / chags pa dang 'dod pa la dga' ba dang / 'dod pa la nges pa dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang /
analyzed: de 'dod pa rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang nges @280a * // par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mi shes pa 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang / chags pa dang 'dod pa la dga' ba dang / 'dod pa la nges pa dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang /
translated: The origin of desire, the disappearance of desire, the enjoyment of desire, the danger in desire, and the escape from desire are not known as they really are.🔽Desire is the desire for sense desires, attachment to sense desires, delight in sense desires, certainty about sense desires, longing for sense desires,

original: 'dod pas brgya la ba dang / 'dod pa la 'chums pa dang / 'dod pa la lhag par 'chums pa dang / 'dod par bying ba dang / 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pas brgya la ba dang / 'dod pa la 'chums pa dang / 'dod pa la lhag par 'chums pa dang / 'dod par bying ba dang / 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa ste /
translated: being overcome by sense desires, being intent on sense desires, being absorbed in sense desires, being attached to sense desires.

original: de'i sems yongs su gtugs nas gnas te 'di ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sems yongs su gtugs nas gnas te 'di ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind is completely taken up with this. This is called the bond of sense desires.

original: de bzhin du srid pa'i sbyor ba dang lta ba'i sbyor ba la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa'i sbyor ba dang lta ba'i sbyor ba la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The bonds of existence and of views should be understood in the same way.

original: ma rig pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bond of ignorance?

original: dge slong dag byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa dag reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang mi snang ba dang ro myang ba dang nyes dmigs dang des bar 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin🔽du rab tu mi shes te /
analyzed: dge slong dag byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa dag reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang mi snang ba dang ro myang ba dang nyes dmigs dang des bar 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes te /
translated: “Monks, childish ordinary beings, who are not learned, do not understand as it really is the origin, the disappearance, the satisfaction, the drawbacks, or the escape in regard to the six bases of contact.

original: de rig pa'i skye mched drug po rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pas de reg pa'i skye mched drug po rnams la mi shes shing ma rig pa rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rig pa'i skye mched drug po rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pas de reg pa'i skye mched drug po rnams la mi shes shing ma rig pa rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: Since they do not understand as it really is the origin, the disappearance, the satisfaction, the drawbacks, or the escape in regard to the six bases of contact, their ignorance in regard to the six bases of contact and their lack of insight into them will increase.

original: 'di ni ma rig pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ma rig pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the application of ignorance.

original: sbyor ba ma yin pa yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ma yin pa yang bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of non-application:

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'dod par mi sbyor ba dang / srid par mi sbyor ba dang / lta bar mi sbyor ba dang / ma rig par mi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod par mi sbyor ba dang / srid par mi sbyor ba dang / lta bar mi sbyor ba dang / ma rig par mi sbyor ba'o //
translated: not to be joined with desire, not to be joined with existence, not to be joined with view, and not to be joined with ignorance.

original: 'dod par mi sbyor ba gang zhe na /🔽'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'dod pa rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: 'dod par mi sbyor ba gang zhe na / 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'dod pa rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: What is meant by not being joined with desire?🔽The noble disciple who is learned knows desire as it really is with its origin, its disappearance, its satisfaction, its danger, and the escape from it.

original: de 'dod pa rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang mi snang ba dang ro myang ba dang nyes dmigs dang des bar 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang / chags pa dang /
analyzed: de 'dod pa rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang mi snang ba dang ro myang ba dang nyes dmigs dang des bar 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang / chags pa dang /
translated: Because he knows desire as it really is with its origin, its disappearance, its satisfaction, its danger, and the escape from it, he is free from desire for desire.

original: 'dod pa la dga' ba dang / 'dod pa la nges pa dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / 'dod pas @280b brgyal ba dang / 'dod pa la 'chums pa dang / 'dod pa la lhag par 'chums pa dang / mi 'dod par byid pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa la dga' ba dang / 'dod pa la nges pa dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / 'dod pas @280b brgyal ba dang / 'dod pa la 'chums pa dang / 'dod pa la lhag par 'chums pa dang / mi 'dod par byid pa dang /
translated: It is to not be attached to desire, to not be attached to certainty, to not be attached to longing, to not be attached to fainting, to not be attached to craving, to not be attached to excessive craving, to not be attached to sleep,

original: 'dod pa la lhag par zhen par mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la lhag par zhen par mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: and to not be attached to excessive desire.

original: de'i sems de la yongs su gtugs te mi gnas pa 'di ni 'dod par mi sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sems de la yongs su gtugs te mi gnas pa 'di ni 'dod par mi sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind does not remain attached to that, and this is called ‘not being attached to desire.’

original: srid par mi sbyor ba dang / lta bar mi sbyor ba yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: srid par mi sbyor ba dang / lta bar mi sbyor ba yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for ‘not being attached to existence’ and ‘not being attached to views.’

original: ma rig pa'i mi sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mi sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is ‘not being attached to ignorance’?

original: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: The noble disciple who has heard much knows as it really is the arising, disappearance, satisfaction, danger, and escape regarding these six sense sources.

original: de reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas de reg pa'i skye mched drug po rnams la mi shes shing ma rig pas rgyas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas de reg pa'i skye mched drug po rnams la mi shes shing ma rig pas rgyas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: “These six sense sources are the origin of contact. They are the non-appearance, the taste, the danger, and the escape from contact. Since he knows them as they are in reality, ignorance does not increase in him through the six sense sources.

original: 'di ni ma rig pa'i sbyor ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ma rig pa'i sbyor ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the absence of the application of ignorance.

original: gzhan yang ston pas 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: gzhan yang ston pas 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Moreover, the Teacher has said:

original: 'dod pas sbyor bas yang dag ldan //
analyzed: 'dod pas sbyor bas yang dag ldan //
translated: “The first is the application of desire.

original: gnyis pa srid pas sbyor ba ste //
analyzed: gnyis pa srid pas sbyor ba ste //
translated: The second is the application of existence.

original: lta ba'i sbyor bas yang dag par //
analyzed: lta ba'i sbyor bas yang dag par //
translated: The third is the application of views.

original: ma rig sbyor ba sngon 'gro bas //
analyzed: ma rig sbyor ba sngon 'gro bas //
translated: The fourth is the application of ignorance.

original: bral zhing 'da' bar dka' ba yin //
analyzed: bral zhing 'da' bar dka' ba yin //
translated: They are difficult to abandon and difficult to transcend.

original: sems can 'khor bar skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can 'khor bar skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Sentient beings are born in saṃsāra.

original: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba rab spangs shing //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba rab spangs shing //
translated: Abandoning the application of desire,🔽and likewise abandoning the application of existence,

original: de bzhin srid pa'i sbyor ba dang // lta ba'i sbyor ba rab spangs shing //
analyzed: de bzhin srid pa'i sbyor ba dang // lta ba'i sbyor ba rab spangs shing //
translated: and abandoning the application of views,🔽and abandoning the application of ignorance,🔽one is called a monk who has crossed over the flood.

original: ma rig sbyor la chags bral zhing //
analyzed: ma rig sbyor la chags bral zhing //
translated: One who is free from attachment to the fetter of ignorance

original: kun sbyor thams cad mi ldan na //
analyzed: kun sbyor thams cad mi ldan na //
translated: and is not endowed with all the fetters

original: yang srid dag tu 'gro mi 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang srid dag tu 'gro mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: will not go to another existence.

original: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags ni nye bar len pa zhes gsungs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags ni nye bar len pa zhes gsungs zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said that craving is appropriation.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag nye bar blangs pa dang nye bar len pa'i chos dag bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag nye bar blangs pa dang nye bar len pa'i chos dag bstan par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, I will teach you the appropriated and the phenomena that are appropriated.

original: de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad bar bya'o //
analyzed: de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad bar bya'o //
translated: Listen to it well and keep it in mind. I will speak.

original: nye bar blang ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar blang ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the appropriated phenomena?

original: mig dang gzugs dang / rna ba dang sgra dang / sna dang dri dang / lce dang ro dang / lus dang reg bya dang / yid dang chos te /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang / rna ba dang sgra dang / sna dang dri dang / lce dang ro dang / lus dang reg bya dang / yid dang chos te /
translated: The eye and forms, the ear and sounds, the nose and smells, the tongue and tastes, the body and touchables, and the mind and phenomena.

original: 'di ni nye bar blang ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //🔽nye bar len pa'i chos @281a * //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar blang ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o // nye bar len pa'i chos @281a * //
translated: These are called the appropriated phenomena.

original: rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnams gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the phenomena that are appropriated?

original: gang las 'dun pa'i 'dod chags te /
analyzed: gang las 'dun pa'i 'dod chags te /
translated: They are the craving that arises from those.

original: 'di ni nye bar len pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar len pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the appropriated phenomena.

original: dge slong dag nye bar blang ba dang / nye bar len pa'i chos rnams bstan par bya'o zhes ngas ji skad du bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dge slong dag nye bar blang ba dang / nye bar len pa'i chos rnams bstan par bya'o zhes ngas ji skad du bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do zhes gsungs te /
translated: “Monks, I have taught the appropriated and the phenomena that are appropriated. I have explained them in detail.

original: de bzhin du mdo gzhan mang po las bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo gzhan mang po las bstan to //
translated: ” In this way, it is taught in many sūtras.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example, in the Sūtra on the Raft, it says:

original: gru rgyun las bzlog phyogs su mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bkri bar bya zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gru rgyun las bzlog phyogs su mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bkri bar bya zhes bya ba la /
translated: “You should turn back from the stream and be carried by the great effort that is directed in the opposite way.

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab kyi smyug ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab kyi smyug ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs te /
translated: ” The Blessed One was dwelling in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana near Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rgyal po'i khab kyi bya rgod phung po'i ri la 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rgyal po'i khab kyi bya rgod phung po'i ri la 'dug par gyur to //
translated: At that time, the venerable Śāriputra was staying on Vulture Peak near Rājagṛha.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus dge slong rnams la bos te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus dge slong rnams la bos te /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra addressed the monks:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di na dge slong dgon pa'am shing drung ngam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di na dge slong dgon pa'am shing drung ngam /
translated: “Venerable Ones, here a monk stays in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree,

original: khang pa stong par song nas 'di ltar so so yang dag par bslab ste /
analyzed: khang pa stong par song nas 'di ltar so so yang dag par bslab ste /
translated: When the house is empty, he should train himself in this way:

original: ci nang gi bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa rnams la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags yod pa zhig so sor myong ngam /
analyzed: ci nang gi bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa rnams la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags yod pa zhig so sor myong ngam /
translated: ‘Do I experience the existence of desire and passion for my own inner desires,🔽or do I experience their nonexistence?’

original: 'on te med pa zhig ces dge slong des mdzes shing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad cing yid la byed de /
analyzed: 'on te med pa zhig ces dge slong des mdzes shing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad cing yid la byed de /
translated: The monk should attend to any beautiful and attractive signs.

original: dge slong des mdzes shing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad cig yid la byas pa na sems bsten pa la gzhol bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dge slong des mdzes shing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad cig yid la byas pa na sems bsten pa la gzhol bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When the monk attends to any beautiful and attractive signs, his mind will be inclined toward settling,

original: bsten pa la 'bab pa dang / bsten pa la bab pa dang / rjes su mthun par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsten pa la 'bab pa dang / bsten pa la bab pa dang / rjes su mthun par 'gyur te /
translated: will be inclined to settle, and will settle, and will be in accord with that.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: gru mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos rgyun las bzlog phyogs su bkri bar bya ba de nyid mngon par 'du bya ba med cing 'bad rtsol chung dus rgyun phyogs su 'khyer ba de bzhin du dge slong des bzang zhing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad cig yid
analyzed: gru mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos rgyun las bzlog phyogs su bkri bar bya ba de nyid mngon par 'du bya ba med cing 'bad rtsol chung dus rgyun phyogs su 'khyer ba de bzhin du dge slong des bzang zhing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad cig yid
translated: Just as a boat that is to be steered against the current requires great effort and exertion, but when it is steered with the current, it moves easily with little effort and exertion, in the same way, the monk should direct his mind to a pleasant object.

original: la byed de dge slong des bzang zhing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad cig yid la byas pa na /
analyzed: la byed de dge slong des bzang zhing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad cig yid la byas pa na /
translated: When the monk directs his mind to a pleasant object,

original: sems bsten pa la gzhol bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sems bsten pa la gzhol bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: his mind becomes inclined to attend to it.🔽When it is inclined to attend to it,

original: bsten pa la 'bab pa dang / bsten pa la bab pa dang / rjes su mthun par gyur na /
analyzed: bsten pa la 'bab pa dang / bsten pa la bab pa dang / rjes su mthun par gyur na /
translated: when it is attending to it, and when it is in accord with it,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag dge slong des 'di ltar nga'i sems rang gi 'du byed kyis nye bar bcom zhing chu bzhin du bsten pa dang / chos rnams kyis nye bar bcom la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag dge slong des 'di ltar nga'i sems rang gi 'du byed kyis nye bar bcom zhing chu bzhin du bsten pa dang / chos rnams kyis nye bar bcom la /
translated: the monk should think, “My mind is being destroyed by my own volition, like a boat that is being destroyed by the current.

original: ma zhi zhing ma dul ba nye bar zhi ba'i lam ma rnyed la rtse gcig tu ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma zhi zhing ma dul ba nye bar zhi ba'i lam ma rnyed la rtse gcig tu ma gyur pa'o //
translated: It is not peaceful, not calm, not delighted, not concentrated, and not unified, and it has not found the path to peace.

original: 'di ltar ngas mdzes @281b shing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad yid la byas pa na sems bsten pa la gzhol bar gyur cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngas mdzes @281b shing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad yid la byas pa na sems bsten pa la gzhol bar gyur cing /
translated: In this way, when I attend to the signs of beauty and charm, my mind becomes engaged in attending to them.

original: bsten pa la 'bab pa dang / bsten pa la bab pa dang / rjes su mthun par 'gyur to zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsten pa la 'bab pa dang / bsten pa la bab pa dang / rjes su mthun par 'gyur to zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that when I am engaged in attending to them, when I am intent on attending to them, and when I am in accord with attending to them,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag dge slong des 'di ltar 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la bdag gi sems 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol lo zhes lung bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag dge slong des 'di ltar 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la bdag gi sems 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol lo zhes lung bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: Venerable friends, a monk should not make such a declaration: ‘I have abandoned the five lower fetters, and I will attain final nirvāṇa there without returning from that destination.’

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di na dge slong dgon pa'am shing drung ngam khang pa stong par song na 'di ltar so sor yang dag par rjes su slob ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di na dge slong dgon pa'am shing drung ngam khang pa stong par song na 'di ltar so sor yang dag par rjes su slob ste /
translated: Venerable friends, a monk who has gone to the wilderness, to the foot of a tree, or to an empty building should train like this:

original: ci bdag nang gi bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa rnams la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags yod pa zhig so sor myong ba'am /
analyzed: ci bdag nang gi bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa rnams la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags yod pa zhig so sor myong ba'am /
translated: ‘Do I have any sensual desire for internal forms?

original: 'on te med pa zhig ces dge slong des mdzes shing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad cig yid la byed de /
analyzed: 'on te med pa zhig ces dge slong des mdzes shing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad cig yid la byed de /
translated: The monk should bring to mind some beautiful and attractive sign.

original: dge slong des mdzes shing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad cig yid la byas nas sems dben pa la gzhol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong des mdzes shing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad cig yid la byas nas sems dben pa la gzhol bar 'gyur /
translated: When the monk has brought to mind some beautiful and attractive sign, his mind will incline toward solitude,

original: dben pa la 'bab pa dang / dben pa la bab pa dang / bsten pa'i rjes su mi mthun par gyur te /🔽'di lta ste khyim bya'am /
analyzed: dben pa la 'bab pa dang / dben pa la bab pa dang / bsten pa'i rjes su mi mthun par gyur te / 'di lta ste khyim bya'am /
translated: will descend upon solitude, and will settle upon solitude, and he will not be inclined to follow after what is to be relied upon.🔽It is just as when a chicken or a partridge is put into a fire: it will be burned, shrivel up, and be destroyed.

original: rgyus dag me'i nang du bcug na tshig cing 'khums te zhu bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du dge slong des mdzes shing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad cing yid la byas pa na sems dben pa la gzhol bar gyur /
analyzed: rgyus dag me'i nang du bcug na tshig cing 'khums te zhu bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du dge slong des mdzes shing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad cing yid la byas pa na sems dben pa la gzhol bar gyur /
translated: In the same way, when the monk has brought to mind some beautiful and attractive sign, his mind will incline toward solitude,

original: dben pa la 'bab pa dang / dben pa la bab pa dang / bsten pa'i rjes su mi mthun par gyur na /
analyzed: dben pa la 'bab pa dang / dben pa la bab pa dang / bsten pa'i rjes su mi mthun par gyur na /
translated: will descend upon solitude, and will settle upon solitude, and he will not be inclined to follow after what is to be relied upon.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag dge slong des 'di ltar nga'i sems rang gi 'du byed kyis nye bar ma bcom zhing /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag dge slong des 'di ltar nga'i sems rang gi 'du byed kyis nye bar ma bcom zhing /
translated: “Venerable ones, that monk should know, ‘My mind is not conquered by my own mental formations,

original: chu bzhin du bstan pa ma yin zhing //
analyzed: chu bzhin du bstan pa ma yin zhing //
translated: it is not like water that is shown to be flowing,

original: chos kyis nye bar ma bcom la //
analyzed: chos kyis nye bar ma bcom la //
translated: it is not conquered by phenomena,

original: zhi zhing dul te nye bar zhi ba'i lam rnyed cing rtse gcig tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: zhi zhing dul te nye bar zhi ba'i lam rnyed cing rtse gcig tu gyur pa ste /
translated: it has found the path of peace, discipline, and tranquility, and has become one-pointed.

original: 'di ltar ngas mdzes shing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad yid la byas pa na sems dben ba la gzhol bar gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngas mdzes shing sdug pa'i mtshan ma cung zad yid la byas pa na sems dben ba la gzhol bar gyur /
translated: Thus, when I attend to any beautiful and attractive signs, my mind inclines toward solitude,

original: dben pa la 'bab pa dang / dben pa la bab pa dang / bsten pa'i rjes su mi mthun par gyur to zhes rig par bya zhing /
analyzed: dben pa la 'bab pa dang / dben pa la bab pa dang / bsten pa'i rjes su mi mthun par gyur to zhes rig par bya zhing /
translated: it flows toward solitude, it settles on solitude, and it does not follow after attendance.’

original: dge slong des 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la nga'i sems 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol lo zhes lung bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong des 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la nga'i sems 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol lo zhes lung bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: That monk should declare, ‘My mind is free from attachment and liberated with regard to the five sense pleasures.’”

original: ci'i phyir lta ba gsum por zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lta ba gsum por zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Why are the three views called “views”?

original: gang yang 'di nyid du gnas mang po bshad de /
analyzed: gang yang 'di nyid du gnas mang po bshad de /
translated: Also, many topics are explained in this text.

original: ji ltar @282a * //
analyzed: ji ltar @282a * //
translated: How?

original: re zhig phung po'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: re zhig phung po'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The verse summary of the aggregates states:🔽Do not delight in birth,🔽the three cessations,

original: skye la mngon dga' mi bya dang // rnam par 'jig pa gsum dag dang // yongs su 'dod dang yang dag mthong //
analyzed: skye la mngon dga' mi bya dang // rnam par 'jig pa gsum dag dang // yongs su 'dod dang yang dag mthong //
translated: complete desire, and seeing reality.

original: sdom du gyur pa phyi ma yin //
analyzed: sdom du gyur pa phyi ma yin //
translated: This is the latter summary.🔽In the first chapter of the Abhidharmakośa, the verse summary of the aggregates states:🔽The Bhagavān declared in the sūtra:

original: zhes sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i mdo las bstan pa mdzod kyi gnas dang por bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las sems pa'i tshogs drug ces gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i mdo las bstan pa mdzod kyi gnas dang por bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las sems pa'i tshogs drug ces gsungs pa ni /
translated: The six collections of consciousness

original: gtso bo bstan pa yin zhes bya bar bris zin to //
analyzed: gtso bo bstan pa yin zhes bya bar bris zin to //
translated: are taught as the primary aggregates.

original: lam gyi tshogs dang mdo mang po dag las te /
analyzed: lam gyi tshogs dang mdo mang po dag las te /
translated: The collections of the path and many sūtras state:

original: de la re zhig dbang po'i sgo'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i mdo bzhi pa las bstan pa /
analyzed: de la re zhig dbang po'i sgo'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i mdo bzhi pa las bstan pa /
translated: In the second verse summary of the sense gates, the four lines of the fourth chapter of the sūtra state:

original: mdzod kyi gnas drug par gang yang bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dag ni bde ba'i tshor ba'o zhes bya bar 'chad par 'gyur bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mdzod kyi gnas drug par gang yang bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dag ni bde ba'i tshor ba'o zhes bya bar 'chad par 'gyur bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The four limbs of supernatural power are the four foundations of mindfulness.🔽The five faculties are the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: de dag kyang gzhi phran tshegs las 'byung ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba la /🔽gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzhi phran tshegs las 'byung ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba la / gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The five powers are the four foundations of mindfulness.🔽The seven factors of enlightenment are the four foundations of mindfulness.🔽The eightfold noble path is the four foundations of mindfulness.🔽The four establishments of mindfulness are the four foundations of mindfulness.🔽The four establishments of mindfulness are the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: dge slong dag chos gcig dang yang dag par ldan na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsten pa'i skal ba med de /🔽'di lta ste 'dod chags so //
analyzed: dge slong dag chos gcig dang yang dag par ldan na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsten pa'i skal ba med de / 'di lta ste 'dod chags so //
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness are the four foundations of mindfulness.🔽The four establishments of mindfulness are the four foundations of mindfulness.🔽The four establishments of mindfulness are the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: 'dod chags dang yang dag par ldan na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsten pa'i skal pa med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang yang dag par ldan na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsten pa'i skal pa med do //
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness are the four foundations of mindfulness.🔽The four establishments of mindfulness are the four foundations of mindfulness.🔽The four establishments of mindfulness are the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: chos gcig dang yang dag par ldan na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsten pa'i skal ba dang ldan te /🔽'di lta ste 'dod chags med pa ste /
analyzed: chos gcig dang yang dag par ldan na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsten pa'i skal ba dang ldan te /🔽'di lta ste 'dod chags med pa ste /
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness are the four foundations of mindfulness.🔽The four establishments of mindfulness are the four foundations of mindfulness.🔽The four establishments of mindfulness are the four foundations of mindfulness.🔽The four establishments of mindfulness are the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: 'dod chags med pa dang ldan na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsten pa'i skal ba yod do //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa dang ldan na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsten pa'i skal ba yod do //
translated: When one is endowed with the absence of desire, one has the fortune to practice the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: ji ltar bsten pa bzhin du bsgom pa yang /
analyzed: ji ltar bsten pa bzhin du bsgom pa yang /
translated: Just as one practices, so one cultivates.

original: lan mang du byed pa dang / rjes su bsrung ba dang / reg pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lan mang du byed pa dang / rjes su bsrung ba dang / reg pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: One does it many times, one protects it, one touches it, and one actualizes it.

original: yang dag par ldan ba ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / mi shes pa dang / mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dang / mngon par shes pa dang mngon par ma shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su ma shes pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par ldan ba ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / mi shes pa dang / mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dang / mngon par shes pa dang mngon par ma shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su ma shes pa dang /
translated: One knows it as it is, one does not know it, one sees it, one does not see it, one has supernormal knowledge of it, one does not have supernormal knowledge of it, one fully understands it, one does not fully understand it,

original: spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa dang / btang ba dang / ma btang ba dang / yongs su btang ba dang yongs su ma btang ba dang / g-yogs pa dang ma g-yogs pa dang / nub pa dang ma nub pa dang /
analyzed: spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa dang / btang ba dang / ma btang ba dang / yongs su btang ba dang yongs su ma btang ba dang / g-yogs pa dang ma g-yogs pa dang / nub pa dang ma nub pa dang /
translated: one abandons it, one does not abandon it, it is obscured, it is not obscured, it is given up, it is not given up, it is fully given up, it is not fully given up, it is covered, it is not covered, it is set, it is not set,

original: yongs su gtugs pa dang yongs su ma gtugs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: yongs su gtugs pa dang yongs su ma gtugs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the limit of the exhaustion of karma and the non-limit of the exhaustion of karma.

original: 'dod chags ji lta ba bzhin du @282b zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / sgyu dang g-yo dang / ngo tsha med pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags ji lta ba bzhin du @282b zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / sgyu dang g-yo dang / ngo tsha med pa dang /
translated: Just as with passion, so also with aversion, delusion, anger, enmity, hypocrisy, maliciousness, envy, avarice, deceit, guile, shamelessness,

original: khrel med pa dang / nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang /
analyzed: khrel med pa dang / nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang /
translated: lack of conscience, pride, arrogance, overweening pride, pride, egoism, false pride, and conceit.

original: bag med pa dang / nges pa dang / yang dag par rtsom pa dang / tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / rnyed pa 'dod pa dang / rnyed pa rnyed pas sgrub pa dang / sdig pa 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: bag med pa dang / nges pa dang / yang dag par rtsom pa dang / tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / rnyed pa 'dod pa dang / rnyed pa rnyed pas sgrub pa dang / sdig pa 'dod pa dang /
translated: So also with heedlessness, certainty, false undertaking, hypocrisy, flattery, innuendo, desire for gain, acquisition of gain through gain, desire for evil,

original: chen po 'dod pa dang / 'dod pas gces sbras byed pa dang / tshig dan dang / sdig pa'i grogs po dang / mi bzod pa dang / 'dod pa dang / yongs su 'dod pa dang / 'dod chags dang / chos ma yin pa la chags pa dang /
analyzed: chen po 'dod pa dang / 'dod pas gces sbras byed pa dang / tshig dan dang / sdig pa'i grogs po dang / mi bzod pa dang / 'dod pa dang / yongs su 'dod pa dang / 'dod chags dang / chos ma yin pa la chags pa dang /
translated: It is to have great desires, to cherish desires, to be deceitful, to be a negative companion, to be intolerant, to desire, to be desirous, to be attached, to be attached to what is contrary to the Dharma,

original: mi 'phrod pa'i ser sna dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / dngos por lta ba dang / dngos po med par lta ba dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang /

translated: If one frequently engages in incorrect mental activity with regard to the phenomena that are the bases of the factors of perfect enlightenment, then the factor of perfect enlightenment of equanimity that has not arisen will not arise and the factor of perfect enlightenment of equanimity that has arisen will deteriorate.

original: 'di lta ste /

translated: If one frequently brings to mind in the correct manner the phenomena that are the bases of the branches of enlightenment—correct view, correct intention, correct speech, correct action, correct livelihood, correct effort, correct mindfulness, correct joy, correct pliancy, correct meditative stabilization, and correct equanimity—then the branch of enlightenment of correct equanimity that has not arisen will arise and that which has arisen will be increased.

original: yangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yangs par 'gyur te /
translated: If one frequently brings to mind in the correct manner the phenomena that are the bases of the factors of perfect enlightenment—the investigation of phenomena, effort, pliancy, concentration, and equanimity—then the factor of perfect enlightenment of equanimity that has not yet arisen will arise, and that which has arisen will be further increased and expanded.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is like, for example,

original: zas kyis lus gnas shing zas la brten te lus gnas kyi zas med par ni ma yin pa de bzhin du byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po rnams kyang zas la brten te gnas kyi @286b zas med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zas kyis lus gnas shing zas la brten te lus gnas kyi zas med par ni ma yin pa de bzhin du byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po rnams kyang zas la brten te gnas kyi @286b zas med par ni ma yin no //
translated: the body that is sustained by food and that is sustained in dependence on food, but not without food. In the same way, the seven factors of enlightenment are sustained in dependence on food, but not without food.

original: dge slong dag dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas gang zhe na /
translated: “Monks, what is the food of the factor of perfect enlightenment that is mindfulness?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams te /
translated: It is the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa lan mang du byed na dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ma skyes pa dag skye bar 'gyur zhing skyes pa dag 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa lan mang du byed na dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ma skyes pa dag skye bar 'gyur zhing skyes pa dag 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one frequently brings to mind the four noble truths in the correct manner, the factor of awakening that is right mindfulness will arise and, once arisen, will increase, grow, and expand.

original: dge slong dag 'di ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas zhes bya'o //
translated: Monks, this is called the nutriment for the factor of awakening that is right mindfulness.

original: dge slong dag chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas gang zhe na /
translated: Monks, what is the nutriment for the factor of awakening that is the investigation of phenomena?

original: dge ba'i chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: It is the investigation of wholesome phenomena and the investigation of unwholesome phenomena.

original: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa lan mang du byed na chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ma skyes pa dag skye bar 'gyur zhing skyes pa dag phyir zhing 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa lan mang du byed na chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ma skyes pa dag skye bar 'gyur zhing skyes pa dag phyir zhing 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one frequently brings to mind the four noble truths in the correct manner, the factor of awakening that is the investigation of phenomena that has not yet arisen will arise, and the factor of awakening that is the investigation of phenomena that has already arisen will increase, expand, and become great.

original: dge slong dag 'di ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas zhes bya'o //
translated: Monks, this is called the food for the factor of awakening that is the investigation of phenomena.

original: dge slong dag brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas gang zhe na /
translated: Monks, what is the food for the factor of awakening that is effort?

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi rnams te /
translated: It is the four right efforts.

original: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa lan mang du byed na brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ma skyes pa skye zhing skyes pa phyir zhing 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa lan mang du byed na brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ma skyes pa skye zhing skyes pa phyir zhing 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur te /
translated: If one frequently brings to mind the four right efforts in the correct manner, the factor of awakening that is effort that has not yet arisen will arise, and the factor of awakening that is effort that has already arisen will increase, expand, and become great.

original: dge slong dag 'di ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas zhes bya'o //
translated: “Monks, this is said to be the food of the factor of awakening that is effort.

original: dge slong dag dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas gang zhe na /
translated: “Monks, what is the food of the factor of awakening that is joy?

original: dga' ba dang dga' ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: dga' ba dang dga' ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams te /
translated: It is the phenomena of joy and the basis of joy.

original: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa lan mang du byed na dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ma skyes pa skye bar 'gyur zhing skyes pa 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa lan mang du byed na dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ma skyes pa skye bar 'gyur zhing skyes pa 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one frequently brings to mind the correct view with regard to that, the factor of awakening that is joy arises in those for whom it has not yet arisen and, for those for whom it has arisen, it increases, grows abundant, and reaches fullness.

original: dge slong dag 'di ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas zhes bya'o //🔽dge slong dag shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas @287a * //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas zhes bya'o // dge slong dag shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas @287a * //
translated: “Monks, this is said to be the food of the factor of awakening that is joy.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: “Monks, what is the food of the factor of awakening that is pliancy?

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
translated: It is physical pliancy and mental pliancy.

original: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa lan mang du byed na shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ma skyes pa skye bar 'gyur zhing skyes pa dag 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa lan mang du byed na shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ma skyes pa skye bar 'gyur zhing skyes pa dag 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur te /
translated: If one frequently brings to mind the correct view, the factor of awakening that is pliancy will arise, and once arisen, it will increase, expand, and mature.

original: dge slong dag 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas zhes bya'o //
translated: Monks, this is called the nutriment for the factor of awakening that is pliancy.

original: dge slong dag ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas gang zhe na /
translated: Monks, what is the nutriment for the factor of awakening that is meditative stabilization?

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan te /
translated: It is meditative stabilization and the causes of meditative stabilization.

original: de la tshul bzhin du /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin du /
translated: If one frequently brings to mind the correct view

original: yid la byed pa lan mang du byed na ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ma skyes pa dag skye bar 'gyur zhing skyes pa dag phyir zhing 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa lan mang du byed na ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ma skyes pa dag skye bar 'gyur zhing skyes pa dag phyir zhing 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur te /
translated: with regard to meditative stabilization and the causes of meditative stabilization, the factor of awakening that is meditative stabilization will arise, and once arisen, it will increase, expand, and mature.

original: dge slong dag 'di ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas zhes bya'o //
translated: “Monks, this is called the food of the factor of awakening that is meditative absorption.

original: dge slong dag btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas gang zhe na /
translated: “Monks, what is the food of the factor of awakening that is equanimity?

original: khams gsum po spangs pa'i khams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams rnams te /
analyzed: khams gsum po spangs pa'i khams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams rnams te /
translated: It is the element of renunciation, the element of detachment, and the element of cessation.

original: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa lan mang du byed na btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ma skyes pa dag skye bar 'gyur zhing skyes pa dag phyir zhing 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa lan mang du byed na btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ma skyes pa dag skye bar 'gyur zhing skyes pa dag phyir zhing 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur te /
translated: If one frequently brings to mind and properly engages with them, the factor of awakening that is equanimity will arise in those for whom it has not yet arisen, and for those for whom it has arisen, it will increase, expand, and reach fulfillment.

original: dge slong dag 'di ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi zas zhes bya ste /
translated: Monks, this is called the food of the factor of awakening that is equanimity.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: zas kyis lus gnas shing zas la brten te lus gnas kyi zas med par ni ma yin pa de bzhin du byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po dag kyang zas kyis gnas shing zas la brten nas gnas kyi /
analyzed: zas kyis lus gnas shing zas la brten te lus gnas kyi zas med par ni ma yin pa de bzhin du byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po dag kyang zas kyis gnas shing zas la brten nas gnas kyi /
translated: Just as the body is sustained by food and is sustained in dependence on food, not without food, in the same way, the seven factors of enlightenment are sustained by food and are sustained in dependence on food,

original: zas med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zas med par ni ma yin no //
translated: not without food.

original: dge slong dag sgrib pa rnam pa lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi zas dang zas ma yin pa bstan par bya yis zhes ngas ji skad du bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag sgrib pa rnam pa lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi zas dang zas ma yin pa bstan par bya yis zhes ngas ji skad du bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Monks, I will teach you the food and non-food for the five obscurations and the seven factors of enlightenment. I will explain in detail what I have taught in brief.”

original: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi rnam par bshad pa nye bar mkho ba las gnas lnga pa phal cher mdo dang sbyar ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi rnam par bshad pa nye bar mkho ba las gnas lnga pa phal cher mdo dang sbyar ba rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the fifth chapter on the majority of sūtra references in the Abhidharmakośabhāṣyaṭīkānāmānuṣaṅgika,
